Review_Date: Rich P wrote a review Mar 10
Review_Title: Don’t let the bad bits put you off….it’s great!
Review_Text: Just back from 5 nights in the Hotel Du Golf and probably a couple of KG heavier! The room…we were accommodated in a ground floor pool view room with a comfortable Super King Sized bed. It was spacious and clean with all the amenities we needed. Air conditioning was adequate but not particularly effective and the shower was behind the free standing bath which was a strange design that allowed water to pool behind the bath. The Pool…Freezing cold but refreshing when the temperature soared to 29C. The decking was dangerously unstable but the manager assured me this was due to be renovated an area at a time soon. Pool bar was welcome an supplied ice cold beer and wine on request and the pool staff were very helpful. Food was excellent we utilised the buffet breakfast lunch and dinner and couldn’t fault it for choice and quality. The staff were also excellent they couldn’t do enough for us and really went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. Special mentions must go to Tarik and Jasmiina for their hospitality. The hotel is getting a little tired but it was a lovely holiday and we would definitely go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jo B wrote a review Mar 10
Review_Text: We have just returned from a week in Marrakech at this hotel. The following should help you decide whether or not it is for you!  1. Beautiful location situated about twenty minutes from Marrakech Medina but hotel offers a regular free shuttle bus into town.  2. The resort is a little tired in places but overall it really is pretty with a gorgeous pool and gardens. There is also a wonderful indoor spa pool situated 5 minutes from main hotel. We used this every morning - we didn’t play golf but other guests said the course plays well. The golf club building is truly beautiful and staff were fantastic when we had dinner there  3. The staff and customer service was faultless - we were really looked after and all done with a smile.  4. The food was delicious with a wide choice of dishes - particularly recommend the pastries and in addition to the main buffet restaurants you have a choice of two other restaurants - both were excellent but make sure you book in advance.  Wine was also very good - lovely pale rose and great G&Ts!  5. Mohammed is in charge of the trips and he is great! We went to the Three Valleys - it was a wonderful experience and good value. Just make sure you ask him to explain what the trips involve.  Great hotel booked via Voyage Prive - all inclusive so good value for the quality of the hotel and its excellent facilities. A big thank you to all the staff at the Golf du Rotana!

Review_Date: Christine T wrote a review Mar 9
Review_Text: Myself and a friend just visited this hotel for one week for some winter sun and to explore Marrakesh and the Atlas Mountains. Where to start… fantastically fabulous on every level. Food is 5 star a lovely combination of Moroccan international and topped off with French pastries to die for. The service from ALL staff was friendly helpful and up there with the best I’ve ever known. Nothing is too much trouble to give you a wonderful stay. Our room was comfortable quiet and spacious with daily cleaning. The wine and gin and tonics excellent all available on all inclusive. They have two outdoor pools (only one heated) and a wonderful pool in the nearby spa. I cannot fault this hotel it is wonderful. One other thing is the hotel also offers trips and MOHAMMED is available to help you choose which ones would be perfect for you. He provides a very good helpful friendly service. We did the Atlas Mountains and three valleys and a visit to the local Hammam. Pick ups and drop offs were prompt and very well organised. I totally recommend this hotel

Review_Date: Shakira Lorraine wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Title: A really Honest review - not the worse but wouldn't rush back.
Review_Text: So my friend and I booked a last minute trip To Marrakesh for New Years and stayed at this hotel. It was supposed to be all-inclusive however was told that this was not an option and only breakfast was included. The hotel room was very basic even after upgrading to a better room. We requested a golf view and got a perfect view of bushes and lemon trees! - wasn't bad but definitely was not the view of the golf course.    The reception staff are somewhat unhelpful/rude/stand offish with the exception of the lady with a blonde short bob and red lipstick (I forgot her name apologises). We wasn't given any information on check in nothing on entertainment restaurants facilities bus timetables to go into the square (markets). I had to go back to reception the next morning to request this. Was given a map/information leaflet written in French ( I understand it's a French speaking country just thought more languages would be available given it's a tourist hotel).    I found the breakfast to be very limited as i do not eat meat. The lovely ladies who make you omelettes in the morning used the same utensils/mixing bowl for the meat and veg. This was extremely shocking to me given that it is a Muslim country I would have thought they would have a separate bowl/utensils for pork.    The gym/spa is quite a walk away from the hotel room on the 3rd day we were told about the hotel cars that can take you to and from by the door staff/ concierge. - they are by far the most helpful members of staff.    Taxi's to the new town/Gueliz will cost about 100DH during the day and double at night so be prepared to haggle and argue it down. If you can try and get a card for a reasonable taxi driver and stick with them.    It's not the most awful hotel but it's just definitely not a 5* more like a 4 ? if you are use to 5* resorts then you will be disappointed.

Review_Title: What could of been a lovely break was absolutely not! Poor service, bad attitudes and rundown property
Review_Text: We picked this to get away over Christmas. The pictures do not reflect the current state of the hotel! It is run down and unloved with less than half the restaurants open. The holiday started off well as we were collected as booked by the hotel 4X4. We ere shown to our 1st room which had a string stench of raw sewage - we obviously declined this room. We had booked two rooms to be adjoining. The second choice of room was virtually in opposite sides of the hotel complex. Apparently they did have rooms next door to one another when I pushed for these. As it was Christmas Eve we booked to be in one of the other restaurants rather than the buffet - we informed them of the food allergy in the party. We turned up for our reservation and after some discussion we were told to be told that rather than the 5 course meal they would be getting just the one course! We promptly left. We had dinner in the buffet where we were told at 9:30pm they had ran out of red wine! We felt the tone had now been set but were willing to give them the benefit of the doubt. That didn't last long - the service by the pool has also been appalling with wrong drinks and food delivered running out of drinks by 3pm and even being told to fetch milk from the kitchen if you want a latte! The food in the buffet has been adequate but frequently runs out by 9pm so don't eat late! We usually go down at 8pm and struggle. They have tried half heartily to cater for the allergy - so unusually in 2022! Then top off your evening in the bar where they will serve you IF they feel like it!    We did bring the issues to the attention of the management but no change really.    The rooms have been meticulously looked after by the wonderful lady taken care of them. Spotless and nothing too much trouble.    The Hammam and Spa have also been excellent and the staff attentive and knowledgeable.    One of the ladies on reception Rana has been particularly helpful and friendly. She has tried her best to make this a more enjoyable stay. Alas she is just one of the people we have encountered and a minority in her approach to customer service.    For those three reasons I have given them 2 rather than 1 in my review.

Review_Date: Jem D wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: Uninspiring hotel, challenging reception staff and in need of a facelift
Review_Text: We booked indirectly (Voyage Prive) and on arrival were told by reception staff that our reservation had been declined they were full and we should contact Voyage Prive a great start (not) to a 60th birthday retreat. Reception staff were just so matter of fact and unhelpful. It turned out there was a Voyage Prive Rep in the hotel and he agreed to sort things out and asked us to wait. Two hours later we were still waiting and having checked on-line with the Rotana website we knew there was availability so approached the reception again only to be told they had no rooms. We asked to see the manager explained the situation and our on-line enquiry and suddenly they had a room for us! Unfortunately after such a poor and unnecessary first impression we started to become more sensitive to drawbacks and faults at this hotel. The main dining room is on the lower ground floor beneath reception it's a self service buffet and you find you own seat and then have to catch the eye of a waiter to have any drinks. The food is good there is a wide selection whilst there only 2 of the 'premier' restaurants were open neither busy but the hotel insist you book 24 hours in advance. The Golf Club bar was relaxed but the options were limited and more like bar food The Italian was quite basic and we food the staff rude. The Pool Bar is ok quality of service was variable no ne explains what is covered under the all-inclusive option we had taken at any time. The Pool side snack bar was ok again only offering 50% of the normal menu. We assume we were outside the main season the hotel was (apart from our last day) very quiet and tired around the edges definitely time for a refurb across the board. The pool was cold not heated and the boardwalk around the outside is a trip hazard beds were basic and towels provided were far too small for the loungers. We had a great time in Marrakesh but spent as little time in the hotel as possible. We were not allowed a late checkout and the only shower and changing facilities are underground near the pool and were disgusting. Shame as I am a Rotana Rewards Member having stayed in other Rotana hotels but this one was the worst by far ultimately I know our initial experience clouded our stay but this is not a 5 start resort by UK standards possibly low 4 star but definitely needs a refurb and some customer service skills training for its reception staff. Waiters in the main dining area were great

Review_Text: A wonderful hotel for exploring marrakech- we stayed here for 10 days all inclusive and it really was brilliant- we had an initial hiccup as we were supposed to be staying in the Palmeraie Rotana but this was sorted in a matter of hours by Fatima on the front desk- she was fantastic and answered my many questions about the facilities. The room was lovely and clean all the common areas were really clean and housekeeping staff always seemed busy in the background. The pool facilities were lovely- the pool itself was cooler but perfect in the hot sun. There was always a sun bed free which was great. The hotel staff all spoke French but their English was really good too!  The food was nice- breakfast was a good selection of continental breakfast items (fruit cereals pastries) as well as pancakes and omelettes cooked fresh and a small selection of hot items Samira (pancakes) was lovely and once they knew my order it was brought to my table. I recommend trying the Moroccan pancakes with honey. Tea and coffee was fair and there was also a selection of fresh juices. Khalid brought us drinks and was really attentive at breakfast.  The food choices were a little limited from the all inclusive as it was the same every day (we usually ate at olive grill at lunch and Zest for dinner). There were menus but we did have one or two buffet nights. The quality was lovely and always very tasty. A special thanks to Tarik at Zest- he was really friendly and looked after us so well in the evenings. Ali and Mohammed at Olive grill were also helpful and attentive.  The hotel is quite far from the main town (15/20 minute car ride from town) and there is very little to do in walking distance (unless you want quad bikes or camel rides on the Palmeraie) but the hotel shuttle was good- the staff dropped us off and picked us up as agreed. We did also get a taxi on a couple of occasions- taxi drivers didn’t know the hotel very well so I would suggest having google maps or similar on your phone if you can! Especially as they don’t always speak English.  We took a number of tours through trip advisor or other websites and hotel pick ups went smoothly on all accounts.  There was a small shop on the Palmeraie resort complex for small souvenirs but we did most of our shopping in the town. There was also a bank and cash machine on the complex (near the gym). We also managed to change some money up at reception but they didn’t have many small bills (same with the cash machine- the smallest amount was 100dr).

Good luck for the whole staff of this wonderful hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nicole Sanchez wrote a review Nov 2020
Review_Text: Youssef the Manager at Zest is so amazing and made myself along with my crew feel so welcomed and special. He took great care of us and made our stay feel like a vacation when we were here for business. The food and drinks were absolutely divine. I recommend for anyone looking to enjoy their stay here and an amazing dining experience!

Review_Date: Joan P wrote a review Nov 2020
Review_Text: Once our server realized we were really interested in authentic Moroccan cuisine Youseff pulled out all the stops. The next night he laid a table fos that took hours to prepare. First came 9 small plates each with its own unique ingredients dripping with intese flavor. Then came the tagines. We had had them before on this trip but these were very well seasoned to bring out the flavors. He then presented us with a Moroccan desert that was heavenly. After that night he brought us appetizers and deserts that were off menu. We just had the best di ing experience.

Review_Date: Abdelouahab B wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: We had a great time in the Hotel and enjoyed very much the hospitality of all the Staff with a special thanks to Miss Samira (FO Manager)for her assistance help care and attention to our requests.Sure we return back

Review_Text: Dear Miss Samira (FO manager) and her wonderfull staff (e.g. Samir Rahel). It was a pleasure staying in this hotel for 3 nights I am looking forward to stay her again. Keep up the good work. I definetly recommand this place.

Review_Date: Gabriela D wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Title: Old reggaton music on the pool!
Review_Text: We came for a relaxed and chill weekend to disconect from the city looking for peace and there was this NON STOP terrible loud pop amd ragateon music on the pool.  The service was really nice and the hotel beautiful but it seemed like a pool party the whole time. Really disapointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is the 2nd time staying at this magical hôtel and we've loved Every minute of it.the room is great perfect.lady on réception betisam very pleasant helpful  respectful .we will definitely be back. Love this hôtel and love Marrakech what a Fantastic vibrantfriendly city you are
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A very easy place to stay.
Review_Text: We went to Marrakech in October for my wife's birthday and so that I could play a little golf. Unfortunately the weather was unseasonably hot being over 40 degrees which ruled out the latter. Still we were lucky enough to find this complex of hotels restaurants and facilities which made the heat at least manageable.    This is a very easy place to stay. The staff in particular were first class. Nothing was too much trouble at any time from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. The driver and car were there at the airport as ordered and indeed all the transport services  to get you around this enormous complex of two hotels several restaurants a night club and the golf course were well organized and efficient.    We stayed in a large room with two double beds and a wet room which made our lives very easy indeed given my wife’s bad back. It overlooked the excellent pool area. Some facilities for example the fitness centre and spa were at the neighboring hotel (the Palmeraie Palace) but this is no distance to walk although the hotel transport service is there in seconds should you need it.    The main restaurant in the hotel is used principally for breakfast which is an extensive buffet with egg station as you would expect. In the morning it is light and airy with a terrace; however in the evening the restaurant is open but is dark and sombre and so is little used. We used other restaurants in the hotel which I will write about separately.    In summary the room was fine and everything worked; and you can eat well; the staff it must be repeated are among the best I have ever experienced but overall it isn’t a 5 star hotel. However this is really only because it is just a bit scruffy around the edges everywhere. It would help substantially to have a full makeover in reception in the main restaurant and on the adjacent terraces.    I forgot one thing. There is a little tailor who provides excellent quality clothes for both men and women at very reasonable prices.

Review_Date: Dave C wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: I’m traveling really often for work and leisure and it’s rare that I’m writing reviews but I must make this review because this hotel is extremely overrated I am guessing how they could give to this place 5 stars for the service it deserves maximum 2 stars. The employee in the reception was rude and not even able to check the availability of the room in order to extend it... seems a joke but unfortunately it’s true. I ask to speak with a manager but she told me that was not possible.. unbelievable. In addition in the morning there is such a bad smell outside the room that it seems you have a open sewer in the lobby which they try to hide with a lot of air freshener that is making the situation even worst.  Last but not less important the food is pricey for the quality offered.    So there are many hotels around I suggest to avoid this one.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Hind O wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: We had a wonderfull time at the hotel.This hotel is classy and beautiful. Sara at the reception was great and very attentive. We might come back just because of her service! I would recommend it to everyone.

Review_Date: MOHAMMED C wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: Very confortable hôtel the breakfast is very goodthe staff are super friendly miss sara in the reception was extremely pleasant and helpful .  This hotel is a good place to go and see another side of Marrakech.

Review_Date: Dora W wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Title: Not bad but could be better
Review_Text: But the hotel is far from the expectations I had from seeing their pictures on the website.  Rooms miss a lot of things: no hairdryer no water no kettle very little pampering products.  Food in the restaurant is average I expected more refined for the price.

A returning guest from the year before I reluctantly came back as part of a group for a 5 night stay:    1. On arrival the porters simply point you to your room no effort to show you to your room hotel layout confusing.  2. Took 2 hours and several calls for an iron only to arrive after requesting a board as well. I was then showed how I could stretch my shirt over the writing desk in the room! Needless to say it didn’t fit he nearly ripped my shirt. Ironing board was finally brought but the legs were broken.  3. Room service awful ordered food paid cash. Guy never came back with 80 Dirhams change from a 200 Dirham note. Took 2 days to resolve on verge of threatening reception with the Police.  4. Restaurant Le Brassiere two hours for the mains to come asked for discount reluctantly given after arguing.  5. Reception/room service rarely pick up the phone.  6. Food and drink prohibitively expensive.  7. Receptionists rude uncaring and don’t offer to help at all.  8. Pool decking worn screws sticking up. One of the guys had a splinter stuck in his foot.  9. Hotel room key card deactivated several times. Each time had to reactivate at reception after being locked out.  10. Hotel buffet dinner simply awful not worth the money.    Others in the group had upset stomachs saw crockery/drink glasses being re-used breakfast fruit juices being poured back into dispensers from guest leftovers.    Unless you enjoy being frustrated helpless and want to be ripped off then go ahead and book.

Review_Date: Roxana P wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: This hotel is definitely not a 5-star hotel maybe a 3-star with serious cleanness and hygiene issues. When I arrived in my room it was barely cleaned: the table and chairs were dirty the carpet was barely vacuumed! I stayed at a 3-star riad in Marrakesh and I have to say that it was cleaner than this pretentious resort.    The quality of the food wasn't great either. It appeared that at the breakfast and dinner buffet they were serving items from the previous days. The food looked very dodgy and expired. The taste was pretty awful and caused me bad stomachaches. The cutlery wasn't washed properly and it was dirty the glasses in which they served the mint tea were dirty too. I was lucky for getting away with stomachaches only!    We also had an issue with the air conditioning! It was impossible to turn it off and we were in great pain as a result (we both got a sore throat).    They were "cleaning" the room every day and a strange thing was happening with the towels: they were taking them away in the morning and bringing them back in the afternoon. Very weird!    For these reasons I will not come back to this hotel again.

Review_Date: Chaimae M wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: We received a warm welcome upon arrival and the hotel room was clean . The hotel is far from any noise we were only surrounded with Palm trees which was very relaxing and peaceful everything is available within the hotel in addition to a free shuttle service that goes to town. I would definitely come back to this hotel as the overall experience was just great.

Although during the ramadam period which can be trying if you are looking for a drink the stay was pleasant. The rooms were comfortable and the bathrooms nice. The pool is great! On the downside during this tiem of the year qith scorching temperatures the air conditioning at the restaurant was broken and that was not pleasant. Also service is something a bit foreign in Morocco and should be improved.

Review_Date: Pua N wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: Beautiful hotel in a large well kept and beautiful complex. Awesome choice of restaurants with lovely buffet and a la carte dining. Taxis available immediately to anywhere.    Hotel staff helpful. Awesome dining.

Review_Date: Nasser A wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: Unfortunately I had to stay due work related reasons as there was a conference nearby. I will NOT stay here again for sure if I have the choice. old rooms low floor small lobby and they get confused if they have a full hotel which was the case in our event. Avoid if you have the choice.

Review_Date: Ravi amar wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: My wife checked into this hotel a day before I did - once in the room she requested for an ironing board and an iron  she was told there were none and had to rather use their services  the next day she took up with a member of staff and was provided with one . BUT the following morning as soon we left for breakfast it was taken away  I requested house keeping for it back as we needed to iron our clothes for a wedding only to be told again there were none  I walked the long trek to reception and spoke to them nd they said go back to your room it will be sent  after waiting 3 hours nothing came . We went to the wedd8ng with Clothes that looked like hell. This morning I found out a friend paid housekeep8ng and they took it from my room. Nobody has bothered to apologize or say anything still . Their service sucks . The bathroom shower in every room is falling off . Should be given an award for bad service .

Review_Date: Pradeep J wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Should get worst hotel of the millennium award . House keeping and room service do not answer . Reception answers after a lot of tries  promises but nothing happens . Attitude sucks . Tried meeting duty manager but does not turn up . Laundry was collected after 6 calls and more than 15 hours . One feels frustrated and helpless .

The location is great the staff were super helpfull especially the lovely Ibtissam she responds to our requests with a warm and welcoming smile she made our stay enjoyable. Thanks Ibtissam and all the staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jozef VdB wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Title: We enjoyed every single minute of our stay in the hotel, resort and city
Review_Text: An amazing hotel with perfect service and large and beautiful rooms. Warm and friendly personal with a very good kitchen. The Spa and swimming pool is perfect and clean. Bus service Free of charge brings you to the city center. Perfect accomodation for all ages and families with kids. We will come back!

No dull moment during our stay! Hotel staff are all magnificent with friendly smiles and genuine hospitality showcasing hôtel du golf and Marrakech.s beauty!especialy Mrs Bissam in.reception Definitely a one of a kind hotel experience with luxurious and massive rooms and endless variety of amenities! Salute to a job well done...  Highly recommended!

Review_Date: Ahmed Mousa wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: This hotel is like no other the second you approach the facility and enter you will witness amazing architecture that is hard to find in today's modern world.  With respect to the staff they were amazing friendly and speak English.  The food is exceptionally tasty a true Moroccan delight. The breakfast was great traditional one and the tea setup is to to die for. The taste was super and the setup and traditional music that we have never heard before made the mood supreme. Myself my wife and my kids had an exceptional stay and great time. The pool and the palm trees were fantastic the activities i.e. dancing sports music made our time enjoyable. The snacks were delicious; lunch had various international and Moroccan dishes the BBQ was perfect. There were many dinner selections and great Italian restaurant.    The rooms were very nice and had a great pool view. The hotel was great to many nearby sights and markets. The hotel play area was great for the kids.    Special thanks to Hind Baha who made our stay non-forgettable. From the moment we arrived Hind ensured everything was perfect; any requests we had were accomplished instantly. Hind's attention to details and hospitality made us feel at home and look forward to coming again. Hind recommended the best outing restaurants and market places. With respect to adult time Hind setup the best ATV two hour ride that was perfect and very scenic. Hind was very courteous and showed us Marrakesh's jewels and setup an English city tour which was very entertaining for all ages that ended in an amazing restaurant.    I would recommend this hotel to families and couples; special kudos to Hind for making our vacation an amazing one.

Review_Date: madina b wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: It was our second time  we even brought our friends with us and they love it too from the doorman with a big welcoming to the front desk manager HIND with a beautiful smile and big help each time we need or have any question she advise us with activities always on the top of everything we need big thank to her and to the all staff  the food was amazing the rooms are clean my kids and our friends had so much fun .  Thanks to everyone until next summer :)

Review_Title: Clean and well-maintained, but remote and lacks on-site entertainment off-season
Review_Text: The rooms are tidy spacious and equipped while the staff are friendly and I encountered no issues. However the location is quite remote and at certain times of the year (I was there in January) there's absolutely nothing to do on site.

Review_Date: Actionhost A wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: Stayed for 1 night. It is a large hotel very quit when when we were there (maybe 20 guests?). Good and fast frontdesk a bit informal but in a good way.    Nice large room good bed. The lunch was top of the bill. The salad is fantastic so was the salmon sandwich. The dinner at the Italian restaurant (free shuttle!) also really good.    We enjoyed our stay.
