He was our bartender throughout the week and can't tell you how good it was to have this guy serving us. Great host if we find our way back to Morocco I'll definitely look this guy up

Review_Date: Fiona F wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: I stayed at hotel du golf from the 16th - 23rd of September. Overall my stay was very pleasant staff were very nice and helpful & not a bit lazy as I had read in previous reviews . We loved the room & decor & the A/C was brilliant and well needed given it was 35-38 degrees .    The breakfast is AMAZING and I had expected this from other reviews We only booked B&B so filled up on breakfast as much as possible . The choices are endless & loved the Moroccan tea being served at breakfast too .    There is a free shuttle bus service that drops you off to the old town which leaves the hotel at certain times and collects you at a certain spot near the big mosque which is very handy as a taxi would be approx €20.00    We used the Palm Spa Gym a few times during our stay which is great and has all the equipment you’d want .  The only negatives would be we found it a bit expensive for food & drink  basically same as irish prices. Also there was no entertainment at all during our stay which wasn’t great  I know it’s probably the quiet season but even someone playing some music would have been nice .    The main pool is great and we mostly had it to ourselves for the first few days which was brilliant .  Overall great place for a relaxing holiday to do nothing . Loved it !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Malcolm S wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Title: Excellent golf and fitness facilities. We were well looked after.
Review_Text: The Hotel du Golf is part of the large Palmeraie Resort on the northern outskirts of Marrakesh.  But for its palm trees it would pass for a complex instantly recognisable to European travellers or international conference attendees seeking sports and golf facilities.  These are indeed excellent and since this was the purpose of our visit not surprisingly we enjoyed ourselves very much!Especially its golf course and extensive practice areas.  There is no question that the hotel itself is very nice.  We were aware of some pretty negative reviews from Trip Adviser colleagues. This was not our experience although its 5 star billing is a wee bit overinflated.  That said we were well looked after and would return without hesitation if golf pool and gym stuff was our primary or major focus - as it often is!  Thank you.

Hotel Du Golf is one of several hotels in the Palmeraie Resort on the outskirts of Marrakech. The resort also contains a number of restaurants some looked better than others a convention centre a large comprehensively equipped gym (7.00-22.00). There's also an indoor pool with a couple of spa baths. The pool area is uninviting and needs some indoor plants and wall decoration. The resort area looked tired. Hotel Du Golf itself looked very nice. There is a large open split level reception with a balcony as you enter. The lower level has a nice lounge/bar area. Check in was chaos. I didn't know at the time of booking that I would coincide with the World Salsa Congress. Fortunately I had asked for a quiet room away from the pool area which looked quite nice as were the grounds. My room itself was very nice indeed with a nice bathroom area. There is a decent sized balcony with comfortable seating overlooking the golf course. The bed was comfortable but the pillows a touch on the hard side. Unfortunately not everything was good (for a 5* hotel). There were no bath robes or slippers. No iron/board. The safe was a metal box in a sliding draw. Fine for passport & wallet useless for a DSLR camera. There was a kettle with coffee & sugar only. No tea or milk. If you want milk you call room service and they charge it to your account. A buffet breakfast was included in my plan (06.30-10.00). The space looked more like a converted function room than a dedicated restaurant there was a dance floor in the middle. It did not match the rest of the hotel. The floors were plain wood the tables were plain not even place mats. The buffet was neither elaborate nor extensive. The selection of cereals (mostly cornflakes and something else) was extremely disappointing. The fresh juices were very sweet. The egg station does a nice omelette.  The location of this resort is good and bad. Good for peace and quiet and bad for isolation! You are stuck to the resort and there is no "popping out" to another restaurant or even supermarket or shop unless you have a car or take a taxi. The resort is not cheap. Most of the staff I came into contact with were pleasant and helpful. Some not so. I had an issue in my room from day 2. When I returned I noticed ants crawling in the tray that contained the coffee sugar & cups. I also found them on my pillow. Upon closer inspection I found a trail of ants running from my balcony to my front door. 3 hours later after 2 phone calls and a visit to reception with a request to change rooms which was denied I had been given 3 promises than someone would come and spray. Nobody ever came and I realized they never would. They simply weren't interested. So I resigned myself to sharing my room with a colony of ants and walked carefully from then on because we all know what happens when you stand on one ant! There was also a serious problem with wasps outside near the pool grill.

Nice décoration but I would rate it as a 4 * due to attention to details done the local way as you could expect. Good breakfast beautifull decoration and landscape uneven staff. Rooms on the second floor hace a nice view on the golf course.

Review_Title: Amazing stay at hotel du golf
Review_Text: We had an amazing time at hotel du golf. Great team with eye for details - high level of service and very warm both personal and professional! We never needed to ask twice the same things. I definitly recommend this hotel!

Came here with mates about two weeks ago and the hotel was really nice like what you see in the pics. However the staff members especially the female receptionist where rude and didn't want to help anytime I asked for their help also they charge such high prices for food and drinks in the hotel and on the resort so beware the food taste crap literally had a crepe every morning stock up on bread during your holiday in Marrakesh in general because the food is awful but yeah the pools where nice although there where so many wasps so annoying put me off sunbathing I had to run all the time.

It is a decent hotel but the pictures probably make the hotel look a bit better than in reality. I don't want to sound to negative as my stay there was just fine with nothing to complain about.    However given the choice I probably not stay there a second time.

I booked a room in this hotel in January for two stays 25-29 June thn 2-6 July. We were really excited due to the good reviews. We arrived at 11pm absolutely knackered to be faced with the wonderful news at reception "your room is cancelled we transfered you to another hotel" no explanation given. My 1 year old boy was tired and so upset the receptionist didn't even think to offer us a seat to calm the wean or give him his bottle all he cared about is that our room is cancelled and he can do nothing for us. We were absolutely shocked the way we got treated or the way the hotel didn't bother to let us know by a simple email that our reservation is cancelled especially our reservation was in place 6months before not a last minute booking that they didn't have time. I would think twice before booking with this hotel.  For me I will never go back to this hotel even for free. I left one star due to tripadvisor minimum requirement in reality they deserve 0 star coz I didn't experience the hotel and due to their lack of customer service.  In the other hand Palmeraie Palace where we were transfered is a dream and excellent. I will leave a separate review for them.

FAO The Hotel Manager    Please can you tell me why you have cancelled my reservation for 2 rooms from 16th to 19th June.    My daughter and I have stayed at the Hotel Du Golf many times since 2013.  We were very much looking forward to visiting again.  We were very disappointed to be told that you have cancelled our rooms due to “technical” error.    I have been on the different hotel reservations websites and rooms are available at Hotel Du Golf on those dates - so why did you cancel???    It is dreadful that you treat returning customers in this way.    Yours sincerely  Gail Blackburn

Review_Date: Houda H wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: The staff was amazing and the view on the golf is just relaxing after a nice swim in the pool or the jacuzzi.  The food was great and you can easily access all of the other hotels of les jardins de la palmeraie resorts.

Review_Date: Mark S wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Title: Nice hotel but service is very poor
Review_Text: Pool good although cold rooms good and beds comfortable and setting is good. However the service over 3 days was consistently poor with most staff not bothered. Also seemed a regular stream of customers complaining. Ran out of beer over 2 days too. Breakfast is fairly good though - so as long as you don’t do anything at the hotel - it’s good!

I was at the hotel for work reasons during 4 days and after my stay this hotel in Europe would be as much a 4 stars since although there are great facilities (pool jacuzzi gym access main hall very well decorated .. .) the service is terrible because in spite of always seeing many workers they seem to do nothing just look ... for example we asked for a table for dinner and they were all occupied but it took more than 5 minutes to start clean one that was unoccupied so we decided not to dine there in addition to the dinner buffet was too expensive (270 dh without a drink) for what was offered ...  The worst: in a 5 star hotel you pay for a fast and efficient service and it is not possible that most of the time there is only one person at the reception in a really big hotel (I saw maximum 2) and time of waiting there take 5-10-15 minutes ...

A family golf and spa break escaping the dreary October weather in the UK. Although the golf was working out a bit expensive the overall break was decently priced. The hotel was very quiet and we were well looked after for most of the time. The rooms were nice and the hotel nicely appointed. Generally the restaurants available on the complex were all good bar a complete service disaster at the Pan Asian where the food we had was good but after a catalogue of service issues we felt we needed to leave to make our point. The general management were very quick to try and rectify the problem which was very good. The team at the pool snack and bar were brilliant. The main hotel bar was a bit more varied in service but for the most part good. Free shuttle to the central market Jamma El-Fna and to any where on the complex.

Review_Title: Nice place, some things to improve
Review_Text: The place is really nice and the rooms are very comfortable  The fitness room is great and the spa as well.  Breakfast is the best thing really enjoyable  The only thing which really needs to be improved is the service far below a five star hotel. It is something that makes the difference  One day they did not change the towels another day they simply did not leave them  I called reception a few times to get information and they never answered this is not acceptable.  Same for room service.  In any other country this would never be a five star hotel
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent almost 10 days at the Hotel Du Golf part of a business trip.  The hotel is part of a huge huge resort composed of 2 hotels a conference center spa and other amenities restaurants shops and others.  You can find anything you need at the resort the pool area is really nice and food is delicious. Rooms are spacious and comfortable we had a suite that was big including a balcony and a terrace.  The only problem with the hotel is the staff they are friendly but lazy and you need to ask for the same thing many times in order to get it.

We spent 5 days at hotel du golf which is part of palmerai village. The compound has 3 hotels and many restaurants spa conference venue pools and a huge golf court.  The hotel is nice from the inside. The rooms are clean and tidy. Service was excellent. The design is modern. Could be a 4 stars hotel in europe. The second more prestigious hotel in the village is palmerai palace.  Hotel du golf is well recommended for families and friends. The breakfast is complete and varried. The only small disadvantage is that the lobby and the breakfast area smell always like food. Otherwise it is a well recommended hotel in marrakech 12 min away from the center by car.

Review_Title: Leisure and Pleasure - Sport and Food
Review_Text: Hotel is part of a large complex that provides excellent spa and golf services alongside 6 very good restaurants all situated within a 10m walk or 3 minute buggy ride.  Staff are top class with a great attitude and relaxed approach to any reasonable request you may have. They always want to please.  Rooms are spacious and acceptable for a 4.5 star hotel although wifi can be a bit iffy.  You can book the restaurants at reception although DO make sure the confirm back to you to avoid confusion.  Golf is ok but research corporate events if you don't want it too busy.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ron M wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Title: Luxury hotel, good value for money. Some shortfalls.
Review_Text: This is a large sprawling two storey resort hotel with 300 rooms situated next to a golf course and a luxury park called "Nikki Beach" (only open during high season) although of course there is no beach but plenty of pools and groovy St.Tropez style double sunbeds. It is situated 15 kilometers from the airport and about 10 kilometers from downtown Marrakech. Nearest supermarket 3km. I was pleasantly surprised that considering Morocco is a Muslim country there was an excellent selection of wines spirits and beers at the little nearby shopping centre. Well stocked supermarket open until 10pm although no sale of alcohol after 8pm.  The hotel is part of the Palmeraie Group and is conjoined with the Palmeraie Palace Hotel next door. Also 300 rooms somewhat more luxurious and more expensive than Hotel du Golf. Both hotels have a large footprint and it's not that easy to walk between the two properties if you want to visit the Spa or one of the many restaurants. However the Concierge will call up a Golf Buggy to transport you from one property to the other. I decided to try the hotel's Italian restaurant "Pasta Cozy" one evening and set off to walk there. After 20 minutes I was exhausted and called for a golf buggy. It must have been well over a mile from my room to the restaurant which is situated at the edge of the property.  All the rooms have a common design and layout all have a balcony/terrace and a huge free standing bath which is a design cross between a banana and a canoe. The ladies will love it!  My room was on the top (second) floor overlooking the beautiful large central pool. The only problem with this is that it also overlooked the children's pool which was very noisy with screaming children from 8am many days. Fortunately the hotel was not particularly busy whilst I was there so it was tolerable. However in high season I can imagine this could be a real problem if you don't like noisy kids.  My main complaint is that the hotel TV system is limited to Moroccan programming and US French and German news channels. There are no BBC or SKY channels and no movie channels whatsoever not even pay-per-view. In my view this is a big drawback for British guests.    Although WiFi is free throughout the hotel the signal is not strong enough in many rooms to allow speedy access to the Internet. I complained about this to the hotel and they were kind enough to upgrade me to a suite which included a WiFi signal booster. This was the only way I could access UK news and watch a movie on my laptop.    I would highly recommend this 4 star luxury hotel as I found it very good value for money. Friendly and efficient staff. Very clean excellent food and drink. I particularly liked the very pleasant fragrance electronically permeating throughout the common parts of the hotel and the fresh flowers placed in my room every couple of days.

Review_Date: Debbie b wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: My family and I spent a wonderful week here. I shared a room with my grandson and my daughter and her partner were next door. Our rooms were linked. Both our rooms were perfect. We were on the ground floor and were able to step straight out of our room and be beside the lovely very clean pool. My only adverse comments are that the restaurant meals and drink were quite expensive. However the meals via room-service were huge and we were more than happy to have a meal of approx £10 to share between 2 of us. It was quiet but perfect for a beautiful relaxing late summer break

Review_Title: Convenient. Not bad, but not great.
Review_Text: On the plus side the hotel has a large campus with lots of good facilities. There are several bars a couple of clubs restaurants a golf course good gym great pools and a golf cart service to shuttle you around. On the down side the restaurants get full very fast the service is very slow (I mean really very slow) and check in / out was a bit of a strain. On check out my card was declined 4 times and I asked the guy repeatedly to try another machine which he refused to do. After calls to my bank and about 20 nervous minutes his colleague finally tried another machine which worked first time. It was all a bit unnecessary. Overall if you want a big hotel it's mostly fine but there will be a few frustrations on the way. Allow extra time for everything.

Good hotel. I wouldn't call it a 5 star hotel maybe a 4. But overall good choice. Grounds are clean and well kept staff are helpful and friendly.  The shuttle bus service is great room service was disappointing as it was very slow and food arrived cold.

Review_Date: Achraf I wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: The hotel is well located in the middle of a "Palm grove" the staff is very friendly especially Mister "Hicham" Who was very kind and professionnal. He offered us a nice room in accordance with our booking request.  I admired the atmosphere and the quiet of the hotel...  The breakfast needs to be improved and the food/beverages prices are very expensive arround the pool and inside the lobby!!!  Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Nice hotel. Check-In was speedy. The rooms were nice with a view of the center court yard with the pool. Clean and spacious rooms. We had breakfast included which was "ok" nothing to write home about considering this was a nicer hotel. The meals overall when ordered at the restaurant or room service are fine. The gym was clean but the only towels we could find are the pool towels and there are no water bottles available at the gym. The gym is a fair walk from the room and hotel in general. This hotel is not the closest to the city center but this hotel offers free shuttle buses to and from the bazaar. Overall I would recommend this hotel and would stay again. The only thing I would suggest if someone from the hotel is reading this is that you should train your staff at least basic English.

Review_Date: Hamza P wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: I stayed in this hotel for 7 days and I was definable recommend it to anyone who is travelling to Marrakech it's lovely the staff and the atmosphere its not to busy and not to dead and I think you'll definitely get your money worth which is what you guys are looking for.    Brilliant

Review_Date: Amina A wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: My stay was really good we had our best vacation.  The services were amazing without forgetting how delicious their food was.  I can't wait for another visit to marrakech so that i can stay there .  P.s : the price is fine too.

Relaxing view from the room on the gardens hotel and pools looks clean. Heated pool at 10 minutes walk from Hotel.  Rush at checkout time enhanced communication with customers/guests should address this little issue.

I just arrived. But I had time to find that my bedroom was after all not ready as they said. Standing there we found an unchanged blanket covered with blood. They change me my the room.    During change I realize that the corridors were not clean with that I mean fries broken dishes packages etc...    I enter the elevator that smelled suet with one light hanging from the ceiling.    I got in to the new room and we found door pullers missing and the faucet mirror out of place.    We went down to eat around 14:30h and they told us that everything was closed so we went to Palmeraie Palace it seemed much better but unfortunately fully booked:(    We got back to Hotel du Golf to the pool. We found bottles and cups down on the water... The poll deck is has gaps and    losing screws wish is dangerous not only to adults but in particular to young children.    I just arrived here with my wife and my 3 years old daughter about 3 hours ago. I'm scared to image how the rest of the week will be!    Felling like we made a big mistake by choosing this hotel!:(

Review_Date: Dorothy O wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: Arrived Marrakesh on a British Airways package holidays. The hotel was beautiful clean and obviously well managed. The breakfast selection was not of international standard but adequate. The staff were nice and friendly but few spoke English. The children's facility was also adequate as it allows you to go into city and visit sites.  The hotel offers transportation into the city which was nice. My problem was that one didn't really tap into the vibe of the real Marrakesh but the touristy one. There is so much dancing hungry snakes and monkeys you can watch. The feeling that most of the people one wants to get money out of you and that becomes the foundation upon which they provide any service.We will not be going back to Marrakesh.Its a city designed to make money out of tourism and I do understand that but not for me.  Sometimes locals who visit the hotel wonder along the hallways making noise or their children treat the hallway as a play ground.

Second time for me here. Consistent everything is great actually much better than its big brother Palmeraie Palace. This one is clean modern nice views on Golf nice garde great service great restaurant clean  Only Wifi experience is weeeeeeaaaaaak. Really inacceptable

Review_Title: My new favorite hotel in Marrakech
Review_Text: I travel to Marrakech frequently and I have been staying in a variety of hotels including this one in the past. My first experience at Hotel du Gold was mixed but this time I am convinced... this is my favorite one. The grounds of the hotels are beautiful and has many nooks to relax in the sun or the shade. The hotel lobby is a beautiful mix of contemporary design and moroccan atmosphere. It's gorgeous. The rooms are modern the bed oh so comfortable! The restaurant offers dining and a great breakfast buffet with egg and crepe station. The location in the Palmeraie is a bit out of the city but it is so refreshing calm and relaxing. I simply love it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Me and my wife had a great time at the Golf hotel with its amazing architecture swimming pool cleanliness irresistible tasty moroccan food and a charming staff.. it couldn't be better to be honest.  Special thanks to Mr Razine and Mr Sharguee who served us at the restaurant hands down.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I had a stay in wonderful and magic Marrakech in New Years. The hotel du Golf had to offer plenty of different parties and celebrations they were so many I didn't know which one to choose! I have to thank one of the staff Miss Lamia for the excellent service she provided to me and the rest of my friends in order to celebrate the dinner'eve and for giving me all the information necessary for that night and the rest of our stay. She is very attentive and caring. What a good start of 2017!

Stayed here recently for business and had a generally positive experience. The property which is a good bit outside of town is lovely and well maintained with a large central pool area and vaulting public spaces in the lobby area. My room was large and comfortable furnished in a Moroccan-ish style. Food on property was fine but not outstanding. On the negative side I found the service to be quite uneven with some staff engaged and helpful and others lackadaisical. Overall a pleasant stay in a very attractive place but an upgrade in service would elevate this property to the next level.

Review_Title: Beautiful property a bit out of the way of Marrakech
Review_Text: I stayed here for work and the location is beautiful! The hotel was very clean and the staff very helpful. The breakfast was amazing. They had an omelet station along with two buffet lines of breakfast food from pastries to meats to olives. Moroccan mint tea is made fresh there. The property restaurants do not open until after 1900 but you are able to order room service during most of the day. There is a heated pool as well as a regular pool which looked awesome although I did not get to use them. This location is a good deal out of the city but the staff is helpful in getting a taxi and there is also a shuttle available. There are some shops on the property and plenty of restaurants if you did not want to leave. I would love to stay here again.

If you are planning to visit Marrakech choose this hotel without any hesitation.    Friendly staff "Reem Lamya .. etc."    Modern hotel  very clean  and excellent breakfast    It was my first visit to Morocco but it wont be the last.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The accomodation is one of the best i have experienced in Marrakesh. the best food as i expected various choices .Moreover i ve got the best room  chambermaids are very available. The atmosphere in the hotel is incredible thanks to the whole staff as the reception team especially Abderahiem who was very friendly and apt for any help during our stay. The only issue is the shuttle bus is not available all the time to go down town.

Review_Date: Iman el wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Text: I have enjoyed my stay at Hotel du golf during COP22 conference in Morocco.  My colleagues and I were welcomed nicely. The hotel is beautifully maintained and our stay was truly memorable thanks to Mrs.Samira who is very costumer oriented and always willing to assist regarding activities in Marrakech. Or simply assist with questions and requests.    I would highly recommend this hotel to friends and colleagues. Well done to the management and staff for the best customer service.

The accommodations at the hotel are very nice with a beautiful pool area. We were also set up with a conference room and projector at our request so we could accomplish several group meetings. The event coordinator was very helpful. When our transportation plans fell through the hotel was able to help arrange long distance transportation for our group.Khalid and Aïtyouss were extremely helpful to everyone.

very nice place beautiful rooms and people working there very kind.  very close to the beautiful golf course of la palmeraie 27 holes always in good conditions.  all perfect except dinner not at the same high level of all the other facilities

Review_Date: Saâd C wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Text: Very cozy and calm hotel very beautiful place. Food and service are really amazing I enjoyed my trip to Marrakech by staying at this hotel. I would like to thank samira erraoui and Mm khallouf for the good service.

The hotel is about 20 mins from the airport by taxi and cost around £20.00    We arrived early and was able to check in  Room was large modern and very comfortable with a super king size bed. With sliding door straight Out to the pool.  Breakfast was amazing with so much choice. The hotel also runs a Brilliant shuttle bus into the Old and New town which is amazing as it save you some money as it is free.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kamal W wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Text: I will definitely come back to this beautiful hotel very good service and a very cheerful personnel especially miss samira erraoui I thank her very much for her welcoming reception and good spontaneity.

Review_Date: Houda IG wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: i would like to thank everyone who received us and took care of our staying my friends from Cote d'Ivoir and me and espacially Mrs Samira El Ghaoui very very nice and helpful person who has an answer for everything...  i will definitely be back to this amazing clean and luxurious Hotel.  thank you again!    PS: nice and clean rooms with private balconies in front of a beautiful swimming pool.

The hotel is located in the quieter posher suburbs of Marrakech away from the bustle of the city center.  The hotel has a very modern feel complimented with an interesting selection of contemporary decor.  Nice enough food free internet and pool facilities. Was able to have a couple of early morning runs around the golf course which was great!  Only thing letting this hotel down is the house keeping. My room was not vacuumed for the entire week I was there- so that bits and pieces that ended up on the carpet stayed there until my departure.  Other than that a nice enough place.

Review_Date: Houda Z wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: Our stay was amazing the location is just perfect with a wonderful view to the golf.. we had a slight issue but Mrs Lamya the guest relation solveded and was helpful and very nice to us during the whole stay  for sure I'll come back during holidays with my family soon..  thank you for you all

Review_Date: Lajos S wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: Clean nice all luxurre. The reception real helpful in all questions. I love it. The breakfast delicious all choisis marvellous. In the evenings live music in the hall was great The singers was good . Outside the garden green and clean perfect organisiert. Everything is perfect for spend a long time in one luxurre place.

Review_Date: Steve Herman wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: Very dark corridors and a tub/shower that is designed to spill water onto the floor if one takes a shower. Very surprised not to be able to get food at any restaurant or at the bar in the late evening. A decent breakfast buffet.

Review_Date: Jane F wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: We could have been anywhere in the world; and we seemed to be the only guests in a huge hotel. There was no atmosphere. Three people in a restaurant for 100+ was terrifying. However it was clean and the staff welcoming.

Review_Title: Nice place to stay or meet - specially if you like Golf
Review_Text: Very nice and luxury Hotel resort I did stay for three nights on business for a meeting and customer convention. Reception was friendly but my experience was distance maybe due to language or whatever. Rooms are great and very well decorated all there what you need and expect. Breakfast is okay and has a broad selection but due to low occupation it was selective even more at the dinner buffet. The hotel was clean but has its areas of improvement my bath tub was leaking and the way to the restaurant was always wet and slippery. Pool looks great and the fun time offering with shuttle service to the center is well positioned. Check out was easy and convenient so its nice for a meeting or event especially if you like Golf - was not mine at all.

Stories from Morocco has always been fascinating. From the famous traveler Ibn-batuta to all the medinas mint teas couscous tajine and many more... I have learned and experienced many things.    Fortunately or Unfortunately I was on business trip and stayed at Hotel du golf Marrakech for a conference. That was my first visit to Morocco and truly amazing stay there. The huge hotel with pleasing views at golf course foods drinks and people all were amazing at the hotel. Big smile at face and warm hearted. always available for your service. From the lobby manager to receptionist and the room services they all have shown needed concerns. The souvenir shop at hotel was interesting as well which helped us to learn about Morocco and Moroccan culture. Ms Khaoula@souvenir shop helped us understand it better and helped us to choose various gifts we looked for. She was very kind to all of us.    We enjoyed our stay at Hotel du golf and looking extremely forward to head back to same place and stay for a week. Trust the next visit gonna be more interesting.

Review_Date: Basma Kharbach wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Title: Wonderful hotel for team building activities
Review_Text: I had the opportunity to stay at Hotel du Gold during the last staff day organised by the company where I work (PwC). I was there with my colleagues.  All I can say is that the stay was delightful. The staff was very nice.  I was contacted by Mrs Khaoula Ezzahzi who asked whether I had everything I needed and she was very available and helpful.    I would definitely recommend this hotel for a staff day or for any other kind of stays.

Review_Date: Edouard T wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: Two hours to check-in because majority of previous guests did not leave their rooms on time! Why the management did not explain the situation to the fifty+ incoming guests and invite them for a drink around the pool instead of letting them queue to hours around the desk without air-conditioning ? Poor management.  At around 6pm we got in our room : water evacuation of the shower was blocked there was towel for one person only the sliding door to the balcony could'nt be closed the safe could'nt be opened ... Poor maintenance.  Obviously this hotel (claiming 5 stars a joke) is either about to be sold or closed.

Review_Title: A nice out of the way hotel with great shuttle into the city
Review_Text: We stayed here for a week and were looking for a relaxing holiday with the option for adventures or day trips. We booked through BA who organised a transfer from the airport which took about 25 minutes. The staff at the hotel are very friendly and polite and ensured we were checked in efficiently and carried our luggage for us.    The room was very big with plenty of space large comfy bed ample storage desk comfy chair and balcony which over looked a golf course. Only strange thing is the bathroom wall has large plastic "blinds" which blank off the space from the eyes but offer no audio coverage so I hope you are comfortable with your partner! On a few occasions the house cleaning didn't give us new towels but a phone call and a few minutes later new ones arrived.    The pools are very nice and again plenty of friendly staff about. It does however seem to take a while for drinks and for orders to arrive once ordered. Sometimes you need to wait for change to brought over took 45 minutes and I had to chase it up once! The pool is large and clean and the smaller "fountain" pool is nice to relax in.    Being far away from the city food options are limited but the on site dinner buffet restaurant is lovely with a wide variety of food on offer each day and very tasty! It starts at about 8pm and there was something different every night yum!    The hotel is actually part of a kind of holiday complex made up of other hotels and golf courses. There are other restaurants and a club near by 10 minute walk and also a bank and excursion booking office - these are all very useful! The excursion office will arrange for transfers to collect from the hotel. The hotel shuttle which runs to the city centre is amazing a safe and quick drop off. We were met by a guide who seemed to be working for the hotel for 200dr he made our journey through the markets and museums a much happier experience as he was an excellent guide.    All in all its a nice hotel if you want to relax far away from the intense city but still be able to get there.It is expensive though as you are isolated so be prepared!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Missing the details for a true 4* hotel
Review_Text: All in all we had a great stay in Hotel Du Golf. The food was excellent and 90% of the staff very friendly and happy to help. There were a few details however which means we probably wouldn't go back. First of all there were always plates in the hall ways from other guests room service some of which stayed there for over 24 hours. Housekeeping didn't always replenish the tea and coffee one time I had a stain on the new sheets.    The pool boys were happy to help married women or those covered up but as two western female travellers we had to wait over 2 hours on the first day to get a towel each and then noticed they would help other guests (as stated above) with moving loungers but not us. We were dressed conservatively too!    All in all a good stay but I think you can get better value for money elsewhere.

Review_Date: Ilyes H wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: Perfectly located hotel in the Palmeraie of Marrakech.  Very friendly and professional staff.  Great balance between the Moroccan architecture and the modern and trendy design.  Rooms are clean and provide great volume.  Great pool and outside areas within the hotel provide comfort with many areas where to sit and enjoy drinks and meals.  Choices of food at the restaurant are limited but of good quality.

Review_Date: Nicole Naji wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: Really beautiful hotel and great staff. My husband know one off the staff and thats was more or less the reason why we went there.    The reason why I dont give 5 is because of the food. It dident impress me if you comepear the standard of the hotel to the food that they served. I aldo think the meny was pretty small not much to choose between. Its sad due they have such a potensial to make it good.    Less then that everything was perfect :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel and staff were amazing. They really looked after my family in every way they could.    They had a prayer room available for all which was fantastic.    I can't give enough praise to the staff for constantly working and being on their feet in order to make this hotel a beautiful place.    Thank you and Shukran hotel du golf    Riaz Azeema Maryam and Adam

Review_Title: Oasis of Calm close to Marrakech!
Review_Text: Stayed here for approx. five days and was very happy with it. There have a free shuttle to where the souks are which was very busy and crowded so found it comforting to return to a serene calm in the evenings. The pool and grounds were beautiful and felt very safe. Very clean!

This is a crazy city so busy interesting hot dusty vibrant and this hotel is the perfect retreat. Clean super polite staff large rooms finished to a high spec. breakfast varied and plentiful. It's a little out of town but the shuttle bus is great or taxis are waiting outside the gate. Very reasonable rates via booking.com. 20 min ride from airport I know theres plenty of accommodation choices in this area but this is a winner for a family.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon for a week and it was absolutely beautiful! It literally looked like paradise with the gardens and grounds. The staff were really friendly even though their English was not great they tried to be as responsive as they could be.  One negative point is housekeeping- they literally did not speak a word of English and did not clean our rooms when requested. On one ocassion i had to call reception to send someone to clean our bath tub- we waited almost 4 hours even though they kept saying someone is one their way. Eventually i found a cleaner in the corridor and begged them to come clean the bathtub. She did a quick 30 second scrub with just a sponge and soap no water (i had to rinse down the tub myself afterwards).  Apart from that everything else was perfect. Room service was great all the staff were truly great. Thank you for making our stay memorable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Charlotte T wrote a review Aug 2016
Review_Text: We had high hopes as the hotel itself is beautiful. Just shockingly badly ran! No information any where on events such as the buffet that is the only meal  Option in the evenings unless you go out or have room service. I gave up trying to get extra pillows after even going to reception twice to ask.... No normal tea in the whole hotel and no lids for tea pots!! No options for dietry needs bring wheat intolerant; I hardly ate and even then after checking ingredients I was ill  No towels at the pool for a few hours after it has opened and even then I think they reuse the wet ones and just dry them off we had a few wet "clean" towels.    I asked for a manager and after twenty minutes gave up!    There is a shuttle into Marrakesh which was great.    As I said the hotel was lovely in itself. Some of the staff were brilliant others; just couldn't be bothered!

we had stayed in an alternative hotel for the first week of our holiday (All Inclusive) and found the staff much friendlier there. most staff in hotel du golf are not friendly which was disappointing. if you do not like wasps do not eat outside at the snack bar. most days we would order food and eat insisde to avoid the swarms of wasps although i think wasps are part and parcel of holidaying on Marrakech  brekfast can be a bit of a nightmare in Hotel Du Golf unless you go before 9am. tables are dirty or none available bread etc runs out and then a mad dash to get some bread when stocks are replenished. only one lady making fried eggs and omlette for whole hotel so queue can get very long ( i waited one morning for almost 20mins by which time there was no bread left!!). juices are concentrated except at weekends when the hotel fills up with local guests and they serve proper orange juice. at weekends very difficult / impossible to get sunbeds unless you go down first thing in the morning.  overall a pleasant hotel but fanta/coke cans by the pool are 50dirham (almost €5 each) in the inside hotel bar (50m away) cans are 30dirham. i recommend you stock up on drinks and water before you arrive !!  food in the restaurants on site is nice. our favourite was the Asian they bring lots of complimentary appetisers. buffet/BBQ dinner in hotel is nice 300dirham per person and kids go free but the other restaurants and probably better value and better choice. Nikki beach nearby is very expensive. cocktails are 220diram each but nice to experience the ambience (no children allowed)  dj at the pool in the evening until approx 11 pm and then the same local musicians play until midnight ever night.

Review_Date: Samir A wrote a review Aug 2016
Review_Text: We had an absolute nightmare when our actual hotel was closed !!! So we got recommended this one we went to reception they gave us a suite with a terrace room was amazing grounds were beautiful pool and sun loungers were brilliant. Air conditioning was brilliant not like other places which blow hot air this was very cool sigh... definite recommend!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Aaah this hotel is superb  The personnel is kind what i very much liked been the decoration of the hotel' its really very nice.  The bathroom is preety the rooms also and reception achieved well  thank you Miss Raja ^^  We spent three very nice days..  I recommend

Review_Date: Agnes M wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Title: An outstanding hotel with the most amazing staff
Review_Text: Hotel du Golf has got very extensive grounds where you just get spoilt for choice. The staff are very courteous and in particular we were helped by a very kind and professional lady who helped us to book all our excursions through the hotel. Insaf told us a lot about the hotel and we hadn't realised that it was actually a full resort. It has a Brazillian and Itslian restaurant plus two other restaurants which serve some very nice traditional delicacies and other goods.  The hotel boasts an indoor and outdoor pool with very beautiful seating areas. Insaf a very knowledgeable and pleasant member of staff enabled us to understand the interesting lighting system of the hotel. The hotel is Eco friendly and is interested in saving the environment . The lights are controlled and turn off automatically during the day and are back on in the evenings as needed. The dimmed lights that align the corridors give the hotel a very calming effect.  The hotel has a very spacious and well equipped gym which also has an outdoor area infront of it with chairs for sunbathing. The hotel lounges are so beautiful if anything more beautiful than they're presented on the website.  The hotel organises tours and we were very lucky that Insaf helped us book the most amazing excursions which included climbing the Atlas Mountains which was a very worthwhile though challenging experience with very strong water falls camel rides buggy tides in the desert and visits to the Berber villages where we bought authentic handmade carpets and argan oil and honey.  The food served by the hotel is very delicious and the buffet has so many varieties. I still miss the fresh juices. The service is excellent and we were given a special breakfast on our last day since we left before breakfast time. The staff are all very kind and friendly and thre is very good security which ensures one's safety.  We did not get enough of the hotel and we would love to visit again and enjoy the mint tea and the shisha a!! We had an amazing time and we'd recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a break away from a busy life as it's very calming with such beautiful and extensive gardens.

Review_Title: Great Place to Stay Outside of Marrakesh
Review_Text: If you are looking for a centrally located/close to the Medina place to stay this is not for you. However if you don't mind its about 30m away from downtown it's a great place to stay! Beautiful lobby/grounds very comfortable bed and wonderful wifi. The food was decent - not out of this world though.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great hotel to kick back and relax...
Review_Text: My first review but happy to be doing it. Hotel Du Golf is my ‘go to’ hotel when I need a short no hassle break from London (and the awful weather). This hotel is perfect for that it ticks all the boxes lovely modern rooms great wifi everywhere (I mean everywhere pool room lobby etc). A fantastic gym better than my PureGym in London a fabulous clean ultra relaxing spa and lovely lovely staff from NourDine at the pool where nothing is too much trouble to Kamal in the pool bar who happily gives out ice-cold towels when temperatures and souring and much needed cocktails (his secret receipe) to the check in staff.    I really love Marrakesh and I know I should try other hotels but when I just want to relax and kick back in the sun this is the spot for me. Its in the Palmeraria district so not much around but the hotel provide a free shuttle bus.    I’ll see you soon Hotel Du Golf :)

Beautiful hotel. Very nice design and lovely pool area. Quality of room very high. Excellent wifi speed available throughout the hotel. It was ramadan and all other restaurants near by were closed you had the option of eating in the hotel or taking the shuttle to the medina (last shuttle leaves at 6pm with last return at 6.30pm). The only options in the hotel were the dinner buffet or room service. The options for room service were limited. We tried the buffet one night by far our most expensive meal we had in Marrakesh it was very disappointing. There was a lot of fillers the hot food options weren't great and no real local dishes......for a 5 star hotel quality of food was 3 at best the staff very friendly and overall stay was enjoyable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Meriame F wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: I really enjoyed my stay at the Hotel du Golf Marrakech; which is very well located!  I particularly liked the hotel's style and amenities as well its outstanding service I was well very nicely hosted.A special thanks to Ozlem in that regard :)  I also enjoyed having my brunch by the hotel's pool....

Review_Title: Easily the worst customer experience for a 5 star.
Review_Text: I stayed at the Hotel Du Golf for 4 nights with my partner. I booked a package with flights through Voyage Prive I was originally booked to stay at their sister hotel - the Palmeraie Palace but due to Ramadan we were moved to Hotel Du Golf.    Upon arriving despite the hotel being empty our room was not ready. The woman at the front desk spoke little to no English so was unable to effectively communicate what time it would be ready.    Throughout the stay the language barrier became an issue even asking staff basic questions like "where is the bathroom" "what time is the shuttle pick up" were either misunderstood or staff had to find another staff member to translate. On one instance we called ahead to double check the time of the shuttle and the woman at the front desk gave us the wrong time meaning we missed the shuttle.    The food was ok - lots of greasy fried food pasta bakes basic salads etc (I'd hate to think if you were GF/DF!) - and awfully repetitive ie. the same spread at breakfast and dinner. The lighting was also so dark at dinner you could not see what anything was.    The hotel lacked any sort of atmosphere. Sitting at dinner was depressing. A huge darkly lit space with about 5-8 staff standing around bad tv on in the background and about half a dozen guests. Despite the number of staff their lack of English which meant they couldn't develop any sort of rapport with customers nor could they be useful when you tried to ask them for things. The only time they had a smile was when they came over with the bill.    My biggest frustration however was not the hotel's compete lack of atmosphere poor English and the mediocre food but the lack of communication between staff members. Envisaging that it would be a long a painful check out given language barriers I thought ahead and decided to settle the bill the night before. During this i was served by a man at check out called Mohammed who was lovely and spoke very good English. He developed instant rapport and gave me more insight into the Moroccan culture than all elements of the hotel combined. He double checked what things were and made sure the bill was all correct. I left having a positive experience.    The next morning as we went to check out I handed over the keys the woman at the front desk (a different one!) told me that I owed them extra money for the lunch meals we had. Despite me having cleared this up the previous night and making it clear that through Voyage Prive we had negotiated a half board that included breakfast and lunch or dinner these costs were appearing on a new bill.    I then pulled up several confirmation emails one which cleared stated "Thank you for your email - I have just checked the original offer details and it states that half board includes breakfast and either lunch or dinner. If you need anything else at all please do let me know" when I showed the woman she proceeded to argue with me tell me that's not how it works when I tried to explain that we had been moved hotels her lack of English meant she could not understand. I then showed her several other confirmations stating the above and she continued to disagree with me. Struggling to read the English she then got a colleague who upon reading realized I was correct.    Instead of apology she was rude and reluctantly made the update.    I left feeling very frustrated and disappointed. But it did not stop there.  Upon getting home back to London I had half a dozen calls from the hotel saying i further owed them money from the dinner the night prior and "it was a problem of posting." (basically their systems hadn't updated which is not my problem!) I emailed them my card details and I'm still waiting for a confirmation and final bill.    All I can say is what an absolute disaster and avoid this hotel!!!!

Review_Title: Below expectations, not to be considered a 5 star Hotel
Review_Text: I have been 6 days at the Hotel du Golf between the end of May and the beginning of June for a Congress and a couple of extra-days of pleasure.    I chose the Hotel du Golf instead of the Palace because from the name I gave for granted it was the one closer to the Golf and where you can breath that golf-hotel vibes I like a lot: I was wrong. The Hotel du Golf is further to the club than the Palace hotel and there is no golfers crowd hangign around at all. It is a modern hotel with clean spacious rooms but that is it. No golf experience to look for in it.    Worst thing is the the food: the quality of the food is of a low 3 star hotel. Absolutely to avoid eating there any meal. All buffet are of very low quality food croissant almost plastic and dinner meals cold over cooked and really bad not worth a euro. DIrty tables sticky of honey and leftovers of previous guests zero service at tables incredibly disappointing.

As great as it may seem at the start you will soon realise... if you don't speak French and they know your English you get such poor treatment!! At breakfast you see everyone getting waited on who can speak the language! If your English it's get it yourself or I'll get that for you and no body comes back with what you asked for sometimes they wait till you finished and then say oh you not want it disgusting behaviour if I'm honest!!  We have asked for towels a few times now and they say yes on the way sir 45 minutes later your still waiting you will call to see what is going on and they just pick up and then put down the phone if we didn't only have 2 days left we would 100% leave this hotel!...! On the other hand it's clean and the rooms are nice with a good pool area but all that for me is ruined by the horrendous treatment and service they provide!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A must place to return to
Review_Text: A great hotel to stay for your time in Marrakesh. Was here for a two days conference and did not want to leave the hotel. Arranged pick-up from the airport was there and the trip to the hotel was smooth. Checked in was efficient. The view from my room overlooking the pool was lovely. Room was spacious with comfortable feel to it making you instantly feel at ease. The balcony had deck chairs to sit and see the sun rise/set something not all hotel have. Wifi was excellent. The bathroom had an interesting design I would have liked more space around the basin to store toiletries.    Breakfast was the usual spread of international buffet. The quality of the service was disappointing. Tables were set up for large groups and not many for 1-2 quite breakfast meeting. Every morning I had to ask for table setting as the table was not refreshed you have to go get your own coffee if you got a cup!    The fitness facility and the pool was top class this made my stay much more relaxing and enjoyable. Although would have preferred the fitness facility to open earlier than 7 am.    Nice bar/lounge area that had a good DJ mixing music not bad to sit relax and have 1-2 drinks with colleagues.    The garden and grounds were very well maintained.    The hotel offered a shuttle bus service to the Medina and returned this is great since the hotel is about 20 mins drive from the main part of town. Although the return shuttle end of 18:30 so if you wanted to have dinner and see the square at night you need to negotiate the taxi ride back.    Overall a good stay.

Review_Title: Nothing nice to say about this hotel
Review_Text: I recently stayed here for a work conference and had the worst experience. My first room was invested with ants. It took several calls to get someone to come down to the room to see the sea of ants taking over my bathroom. They were incredibly unhelpful in cleaning them up and getting me another room. Finally I was able to move rooms and they placed me in a room that the AC didn't work. 100 degrees and no air conditioning is unacceptable. Again called and they said they would send a tech...of course no one came. I finally secured a room at the palace hotel in the same resort and had to call the front desk three times to have someone help me move rooms again. Common theme customer service is not a priority in this hotel and no concern for fixing unacceptable rooming conditions. Additionally several other conference attendees had to be moved as well...how they are considered five stars is beyond me!

This was our first visit to Marrakech and I would definitely say that all the staff from the reception people to the breakfast bar to hotel keeping (especially Rachid who would visit our room every day and ask how we were such a delightful man) and welcoming staff at the door made our trip the most memorable.We were given a double room rather than a triple when we arrived but still the staff went out of the way to change our rooms and gave them next to each other near the reception. Cleanliness was A+. Our rooms were cleaned to an excellent standard every single day the maid done a fantastic job of making sure our room was spotless The staff would always be smiley and ask us how we were would visit our room just to see if we was comfortable as my family became a little ill. The staff are just so polite and nice even down to the security guys ...absolute credit to the management. A special thanks to the reception for dealing with any enquiries for us quickly and efficiently who welcomed us so much and made the process so easy especially Rim Ozlem and Hicham. Free wifi in all rooms which works amazing from the full length of the hotel.    Hotel amenities and location absolutely fantastic and away from the hustle bustle of the Medina. Nothing was too much trouble as there was a taxi rank outside and a complimentary shuttle running 4 times a day to Medina and Gueliz. Very attentive staff. All excursions booked were of highest quality and great value and were explained in great detail to us by Ozlem . The Nikki Beach is also at walking distance.  The breakfast served in the restaurant offered something for everyone and was excellent serving a range of food. The breakfast staff were always welcoming every morning and went out of their way to serve us in the best way possible and would always come for a chat especially Razine Housseine Abdessmad and Berkan Hanane and the manager. Apologies if I have forgotten any names. Would be a great start to the day with their compliments  Can't wait to return. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel as not only is it situated in an ideal position it is well run and the rooms are fantastic.  Thanks for making our stay perfect!!!!    Wasim/Yasmin

Review_Title: Nice rooms and pool, but some staff let the place down
Review_Text: We visited Hotel Du Golf at the end of May for a long weekend and were generally happy with our visit but it was nothing out of the ordinary.    On arrival the hotel entrance is grand and well kept but straight away we were left waiting a long time at the check in desk and no welcome was really given to us we were silently presented with a form to fill in each (but only one pen) and that was the extent of the welcome. When we were finally checked in one of the bell hops guided us to our room (6227) which was on the second floor. The room was nice and well appointed with a giant bed and selection of pillows. Wifi was free and fast. After having a shower which is located above a bath I realised that it wasn't the best design with lots of water finding it's way onto the floor behind the bath. The shower head would also not stay high enough and kept slipping down the shower head pole (although this only occurred on one occasion).    The hotel was very quiet which was good during the day by the pool with loads of free loungers as well as peace and quiet to relax although it was a bit eery on the night of our arrival. We wanted some food but other than room service the only food available was a buffet. We ventured out into the resort and after a short walk found a french style restaurant which did the job.    Breakfast was good with a wide variety served until 1030. The selection was getting limited nearer the end of service but we generally found something we wanted. Mineral water was a hard thing to come by at breakfast with only one small bottle available and many times we had to ask numerous times for more to be provided. For whatever reason they seemed to be a bit against providing water! Food by the pool was good and reasonable value and we ate here a number of times. Service was good.    The hotel is located well out of town but they provide a shuttle service into town which was good. Taxi's back cost 150 MAD. We found this good as we wanted to mainly relax by the pool with the ability to see a bit of Marrakech too.    Overall I would recommend this hotel but the staff at breakfast and on the front desk had a very unhelpful attitude which stopped it from getting a 4 star rating.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great Hotel & Value, let down by service
Review_Text: My wife and I wanted a weeks golfing break with some interesting site seeing/dining etc on hand. Marrakech seemed to fit the bill. We got a flights and hotel package with BA which was truly excellent value. The hotel is as you see in the pictures on Trip Advisor. Great layout modern & funky with loads of space. It's connected to The Palmerie Palace Hotel and Golf Club. This means the Gym Spa multiple restaurants and bars night clubs golf are all walking distance and you have access to everything. There's a shuttle around the resort too. They need to watch the quality of the maintenance few signs of corners being cut and wear and tear being ignored. I think it links into my notes about the service culture issues below.    Golf course was pretty good and a round with clubs and buggy was £80/person. Don't expect a Top 100 course with beautiful views of Snow Capped Atlas Mountains as a few photos might appear. That's a pro photographer with a 600mm lens. It's a solid round of holiday golf.    Whilst we were there the hotel was almost empty for some reason. Suited us. Pick of sun bed table tee-time etc. But very quiet and lacking any holiday buzz at the bar.    Service in the hotel is very mixed. There is a bit of a language issue I think with Arabic & French. But that said they could really do with some new managers that would get staff focused on serving guests rather than chatting/texting and fixing stuff. I had to complain several times about wrong orders drinks taking 30 mins forgotten orders etc. Given the place was so empty it was really bad and a million miles from somewhere like the Four Seasons. Staff themselves were nice enough but they will get a really bad reputation if they don't pull their socks up.    Marrakech is an experience and not for the faint hearted. We've travelled a fair amount but never experienced a place where it seems absolutely everyone is trying to rip you off of a few bucks at every opportunity. Taxi unofficial guides every store you glance into. It's relentless and because the Medena area is such an incredible maze of tiny streets it's almost impossible not to appear like the lost tourist. My advice would be:  1) First visit have a guided tour arranged by your hotel.  2) Budget £50 in small notes to oil the wheels and get shot of people. They are so persistent the only other way is shouting/aggression and that's stressful.  All this said it's an amazing place and with a bit of planning will be a great experience.    Highlight of our trip was our 3 Valley Tour to the Atlas Mountain. Walked up cascades to a beautiful waterfall and ate Tagine in a Berber village. Brilliant.

Review_Title: Peace and quiet in beautiful surroundings
Review_Text: I was looking for peace and quiet close enough to the city for sightseeing but with a touch of luxury and plenty of facilities. This was all to hand at the hotel. The room overlooked the golf course and the balcony had sun in the afternoon. My room was very clean well equipped and the bed was so so comfortable!  The free shuttle bus into Marrakech runs 4 or 5 times a day and as I was on my own the driver was aware to look out for me at the pick up point in Marrakech. On organising trips the reception staff were very helpful and friendly - thank you Hayat and Safia!  The dining room was fine but I would suggest that greater attention should be paid to the cleanliness of the floor - particularly at breakfast. The breakfast choice was excellent although the evening meals were a little disappointing and the choice did not vary very much.  The lounge/bar area is beautiful luxury with comfort. On 2 of the evenings there was a saxophonist playing and he was extremely talented.  I found all the staff to be attentive and friendly - particularly on Reception as mentioned previously and also the porters. In other areas I found that if I was pleasant and made the effort then so did the staff.  If visiting Marrakech again then I would definitely stay at the Hotel du Golf.

First impressions was a nice modern clean hotel our room faced the golf course balcony was always shaded never use it !  Didn't meet any of the fabulous staff that other reviews mentioned found the staff pleasant but indifferent have to mention the young guy that worked in the breakfast dining room that was not just rude but look at us with such distain.  Breakfast was good wide selection of hot and cold buffet but otherwise food at this hotel was a disaster !!!  Evening menu in hotel was a buffet salad various meats and veg desserts all of which was very poor quality cold and overpriced.  There is a number of other restaurants in the resort we tried Cosy Pasta Brazilian Dinner & Show Amedus none of which impressed me all over priced !  Dinner with one drink each will set you back approx €80.00 Pool side burger/ sandwich with a coffee for two will cost approx €35.00.  Outdoor pool area was lovely lots of different seating options but the pool water was freezing so swimming not a option  The shuttle bus only runs a couple time a day with the last bus returning at 18.30pm and with a taxi costing €20.00 from Marrakech to hotel it limits any other options for dining  Biggest disappointment was the Spa it was disgusting Pool area was old mouldy broken tiles changing area was shabby and spa staff rude and pushy  I was so disappointed as I had look at so many resorts all around the same price range and choose this hotel after reading reviews wish I hadn't.

Hotel du golf was far below expectations. We arrived early and tried to check in but our rooms were not ready. So we went for breakfast. Even though we had not checked in yet the staff kindly allowed us to get in. Realizing that this first breakfast was not included in our package the restaurant manager started chasing us one by one to secure his 15 Euros in cash which we of course were willing to pay. But instead of putting it on our future rooms and settle this later we were treated like thieves!    Later we got our rooms. In the booking it was agreed we would have rooms with view on the golf or the swimming pool. No need to mention we got a room on the street. We didn't fight it because this was supposed to be a holiday weekend we already lost too much time with the check in.    Then decided to go to town with the complimentary mini bus. The 15 seaters mini bus was nearly full when arriving. They share it with the hotel next door (the palmeraie golf palace). No alternative was given but to take a taxi the hotel would not organize an additonal service. Fort the next days we went to the Palmeraie to be sure to have a seat.    The rooms are nice large enough and comfortable. The bathroom is another story! The shower has no door and no curtain so there is water everywhere. The shower rail was broker and it was not possible to block it in the middle or top if the rail so I asked for it to be fixed when leaving in the morning. Of course it was not fixed on the evening so we continued using it the best we could spilling water everywhere.    Dogs are apparently admitted as we could find one bothering us just next to the outdoor swimming pool...    For the indoor swimming pool spa and sauna it takes place at the Palmeraie palace next door. The changing room looks like one from the eighties that has never been refurbished. The staff gives you a towel... if there are enough remaining! For the slippers you have to ask. Bathrobe are not provided so you have to come with your own from your room.    On the positive side the breakfast buffet has a lot of choice and the dinning room very large.    The service has always been good and the staff helpful and very kind and polite doing as much as they could.    Unfortunately the management is far less competent than their subordinates.
