I had made a reservation at the Palmeraie Golf Palace Hotel a month before and due to overbooking (a mistake by the Hotel reservation team) the Hotel Management took the liberty to change my reservation to Hotel du Golf five days before my trip! After much protest they apologized but said that nothing could be done. So much for customer service it's awful all the way.  The rooms are clean and most of them come with a nice view of the golf course the courtyard or the swimming pool. The bed is comfortable and linen is clean and warm. The room is spacious and can accommodate three people or a family of four (2 small children). There is also free internet (wifi) in the rooms. Bathrooms are small and amenities are below standard. There is a coffee maker in the room with coffee and tea but no milk. Two water bottles are provided the first day and additional bottles come at aprice of €2 per bottle.  The hotel has a pool but no gym. If you want to work out then one has to go to the gym in the Golf Palace Hotel which is a ten minute walk. There are no hotel shops and only one restaurant which serves buffet food (nothing great). The hotel is also located about twenty minutes from the city center; although there are free shuttle buses that take you there and back the schedule may not be to your liking. Taxis cost about €10 to get to town.  In a nutshell - avoid if you can!

Review_Date: King A wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: Each place is clean and has been receiving me professionally and wonderful by employees Mm.Hasna & Mm.Halima are doing their part well  One of the best Hotels that I visited in Morocco  thank you  Nedjadi Bachir  Room:5140

This is truly a great place. Staff is very attentive to details. Rooms are very comfortable. The spa is great. The gym is excellent. The pool is wonderful and the food is delicious (even though the food menu for room service should offer more options). My only suggestion is that the pool at the gym could be heated. Again this is a fantastic place!

Stayed for four days late October while attending conference. Pleasant enough hotel though closer to 3.5 stars than the 5 claimed....rooms comfortable though geared to holidaymakers not business travellers nice pool.    hotel brought down down by hopeless/slow service particularly at breakfast but also at pool restaurant for lunch. Staff at service/concierge desk less than helpful....."I wonder whether you have a street map of Marrakesh? " elicits the short/sharp answer "No".

Review_Date: Dave T wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: Normally I stay at the Palace but due to short notice and a Conference at the Palace I had the opportunity to stay at the Hotel du Golf instead.    Overall very impressed!    Only minor issue was the breakfast "chaos"...the staff on the floor honestly looked confused...tables were not set/cleaned/cleared coffee carafes were empty...bit surprising to me as I have stayed several times at the Palace and well spoiled by the Breakfast at the pool!

Review_Date: ilham d wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: First the hotel is splendid newthe rooms are very clean nice with modern design. The staff is very lovely and professional. The restaurant is good serving very delicious buffets. i like this hotel and if you want to travel in Marrakech I suggest you hotel Golf

I have taken some time to write this review as it's been rattling around in my head since our visit in August (2014) and I needed some time to reflect. All of the points I am about to make have been personally discussed with the duty manager of the day when we checked out. When asked 'How was your stay' we felt it only right to tell it how we had found it. I felt like a 'Secret shopper'. This is a beautiful hotel and has the appearance of a newly refurbished high end establishment. Lush surroundings on a golf course in a new development of high end hotels. Beautiful modern rooms with a very comfortable bed one of the best we have ever slept in. The room was very clean and the bathroom was quirky and fun. Tea and coffee facilities. A free shuttle bus takes you to all the other hotels to use their restaurants or the independent restaurants along the main strip. We had a fantastic entertaining evening with fab food in the Brazilian restaurant next door one night and really good Sushi the following evening. On the last night we ventured a little further (by free bus) to the really lovely Italian and the food was great.  So that is all the positives....................  During August the temperature averages at 40 C on arrival there was complimentary bottled water in our room during our 5 day stay we never saw another bottle either complimentary or to buy. Our mini bar was completely empty and never filled.  Breakfast was complete chaos tables were never cleared and you had to wait to sit down and clear it yourselves. The breakfast manager looked like he was going to have a complete breakdown and I dared not ask for plates when there weren't any a simple requirement. The food was ok and plentiful a station for pancakes and eggs or omelettes. One morning a guy appeared and was squeezing fresh orange juice on a 'push down' hand operated juicer the queue was around the restaurant and not even an option to join.  The pool area was packed and the obligatory towels on beds occurred early in the morning. Not a problem for us as sitting around the area around the pool involved being subject to loud pumping disco music all day!! To the left of this area was a quiet area with comfy double sunbeds and lovely tables and chairs and small fountains. This suited us fine. Unfortunately on 2 mornings the pool towels had run out by 10am. A trip back at 11am and the second delivery had also dried up (excuse the pun)!  The pool bar was severely understaffed and you could only feel sorry for the poor blokes on duty. Grabbing their attention was an art in itself but half an hour for a coke was just a joke. Sorry we have no ice madame what!!!!!  The swimming pool itself is grubby with broken decking and bare nails. The water was full of hair and it could be seen floating on the top!    This hotel needs some good management putting in place and should not expect that the plush surroundings will disguise the terrible levels of service.    I would happily return to help sort out the problems here but would skip breakfast!!!!

Review_Title: A nice hotel but very poor service
Review_Text: Although most of the time friendly the staff has obvisouly absolutely no idea what they're doing. We've ordered a breakfast and had roughly half of our order some missing and some wrong and had to argue (!) to get what we were paying for (which we didn't anyway). The exact same story happened at the spa where I had to argue again to get the massage I was paying for instead of the basic black soap hammam. I eventually managed to get half of my massage. When I complained the spa desk simply chose to ignore me and I had to wait for a polite customer to tell the lady that I was there before. They finally offered me a massage for the next day which of course I didn't accept (I wasn't going to spend the whole weekend in this spa).  To sum it up the building are nice but next time I'll add 1000dh and go to the Essaadi Palace for a real 5 star / palace service quality.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Saad Abid wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Title: Everything you need in one place
Review_Text: First of all you have to make sure that you reserve at the new hotel du Golf and not the Palmeraie Golf Palace. Since it's the same company sometimes you might make a mistake.  What i loved about this hotel is that it's new the rooms are nice the design very modern. I loved the furnitures because you can feel that there is a same pattern that you can find in all the hotel even in the lobby restaurant and of course the rooms.  The staff is nice welcoming and very helpful. I was there for a 3 day conference and everyhting went well.  Now the thing that i loved the most is that the complex has everything that someone might need in a walking distance. From gym to golf to nightclub to restaurant to tapas bar ...I run a lot and there is a good track in the golf.  One advice is not to go during august cause it's too hot.

I stayed with my family for Sommer break. It has a very impressive outlook and very clean and spacious roomsalso very high standard lounge and seating area for guests.very friendly and reliable service. we had breakfast there it was buffet type. We went out for lunch and dinner and benefitted from their own shuttle bus which was convenient and suited for our needs. Bus driver was frindly and was able to suggest places to visit. Only thing which could improve this service if the shuttle bus had few more pick up and drop off points from more than two location. It has a amazing garden and a beautiful pool surrounded by gorgeous palm trees. My kids loves to swim really enjoyed their outdoor swimming pool. Overall we had an amazing experience would love to revisit.

I stayed for a conference for 4 nights. The only reason I give upgraded my score to an average score was because the wifi in the room was excellent and the staff on reception were very nice if it wasnt for this it would have got a poor. The bathtub with shower curtain around made showering not very refreshing poor water flow and water everywhere. No soap holder at the sink and hard towels. Bed was comfortable and plenty of space to hang your clothes room wasnt anything special. Service went down hill in the restaurant getting attention to order a drink waiting forever for it to arrive thats if you got what you ordered and no explanation of how the buffet worked the first night they seated me so I could only see the salad selection When I said is this all that is on offer tonight they said yes 300MAD very expensive. When I askedd for butter they said they did not have any yet they had butter at breakfast! I dont think they could be bothered. I had no idea there was a cooking station on the other side of the restaurant. Although I dont think it was open as there were only 4 people in the restaurant. Fly's on the food. Lunch was better and no flys! but we saw the staff taking our drinks we prepaid and hiding them behind the counter even though we didnt order wine there were wine glasses on the table and not the coffee cups we would expect in fact when I did ask where the coffee was it arrived just as we had to leave! The pool looked refreshing but I wouldnt want to stay here on holiday its just overrun with conferences. I ordered an english tea they asked if I wanted milk which I said yes what came was a tea bag on a plate and a teapot full of hot milk. The conference staff let our team down but I am trying to review the hotel and the facilties fairly. Drinks and food is expensive in this hotel so I would expect better service and understanding of European standards if this were to improve them certainly it would be worth trying. For a conference certainly never again.

The staff are very courteous and friendly. The room was clean and comfortable. The AC worked fine and all equipments were in good working conditions. The hotel is quite which was what we needed for a relaxing week-end. The breakfast buffet was fantastic ! It is too bad that all restaurants are located in the Palmerai Golf Palace next door. The golf course was OK and not too crowded but no discount on the green fee was offered to hotel residents which what one might expect by staying there. A small practical suggestion is to post direction signs for the hotel at the entrance from the road from Casablanca which would avoid the hassle of having to stop and ask people for directions.

Review_Date: Per S wrote a review May 2014
Review_Text: This Holiday Inn is located in the palmerie its some 20 min from the historical marrakech medina. If you have decided to stay in the palmerie (for golf or resort) this is an OK/value for money option. The hotel is newly built has high standard and really big nice rooms with lounge areas double bathrooms etc. The poolarea is also very nice. Overall a nice resort hotel. What it lacks is personality and service. Its a huge complex and I prefer the nicer smaller riads or more upscale luxuary hotels when staying in Marrakech. If however you want golf and a generic resort experience this hotel works fine and you will get great rooms for a bargain compared to the neighbour hotels
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Maria A wrote a review May 2014
Review_Text: I attended the ICN Conference Meeting there last month. Hotel was really nice however service not so good. I believe it is a problem of Marrocs and not really from the hotel because the staff was always really nice. Rooms are conformable and breakfast too. The only problem is the distance from the city however the hotel offers vans that go the city several times.

Review_Date: pierre l wrote a review May 2014
Review_Text: Very pleasant environment the staff was very helpful the area was perfect for resting I would recommend you try the spa as well  Don't miss the amazing breakfast  A big thanks to the Hotel team especially Miss Samia

I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights in April 2014 for a conference. When I arrived home I realised that I had left my favorite shirt hanging in the cupboard in my room. I emailed the hotel to ask if they could save my shirt and pass it to a colleague staying at the hotel. However the hotel didn't respond to multiple emails nor telephone calls. Once the hotel has taken your money and you have left obviously they care nothing for service. Or maybe they don't pay their staff enough and they have to supplement income with guests shirts?

Review_Date: Missy J wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Title: Amazing stay in this African paradise
Review_Text: Getting there & Check in  We got to the hotel by taxi from the airport and it cost us 150 dirhams about £12. We were met by the bell boy/porter who welcomed us and carried our suitcases into the lobby. We were asked to sit down and fill in some forms. They asked for my bank card and they said it was just for guarantee. The receptionists were ok I saw faint smiles here and there. I think the staff are quite nice when you get to know them they just have difficulty communicating fluently in English so they are hesitant to make conversations .  The receptionist explained breakfast times and pointed us to where the spa and fitness room were. I asked about the Internet and shuttle and she showed me the hours that the bus comes. Someone carried our luggage to our room and then showed us where everything was in the room. When we tried to give him a tip he said no it was ok he was just doing his job. Amazing to get service without the expectation of a tip.    The Room  When we got to our room we were stunned by how beautiful it was. Our room was the standard room but quite stunning with very modern decor and amenities. There was an LCD tv with what I think was some kind of cable..lots of channels inc CNN MTV Max movie channel Bloomberg MBC1-4 and others in French and Arabic.  The bathroom had a lovely oval shaped bathtub with shower option and toilet with a sliding door. There was a balcony overlooking the golf course and mountains Tea and coffee facilities but no milk. Hairdryer sep toilet .  The only downside was that there was barely any wifi signal in our room maybe because it was at the back. We mentioned at reception and they said they would send someone the next day to look into it. The person never came but we would once in a while get two bars of wifi that came for a few mnutes and disappeared for hours.    Food & Dining and Service from Staff  We went to the restaurant on one night for dinner. It was a buffet nothing special. 280 Dirhams per person. Several meat dishes including chicken lamb fish pasta rice salads etc  Breakfast is varied with plenty of cooked and continental food available. They also make pancakes and omelettes while you wait.  They have Moroccan and English tea but no herbal or green tea unfortunately which I love. They do have the Moroccan mint tea which is ok.  The staff speak French mostly but some can speak a bit of English. Contrary to what other reviewers said the staff were quite helpful and very friendly towards us and we can barely string a sentence in French.  Every evening they came to our room about 7pm to ask if we were ok if we needed any towels pillows teas etc  We used room service for dinner twice and it was good value and food was tasty. Much better value than buffet if you want a la carte.    Hotel and Services  The Lobby and outside pool area is stunning at night. Lots of lights and lit up fountains.  Beautiful pool area shame the weather wasn't great during our visit so we didn't make use of this lovely area. The indoor pool which is located in another sister hotel down the road was a bit far for us to bother with. There is a shop were you can get drinks snacks like biscuits sweets etc which other reviews said was 5-10 mins away...it's quite far more like 18-20 mins brisk walk.  There was a conference on the day we arrived thankfully it finished the next day.  Hotel was quiet close to empty and very clean.  After reading other reviews we were worried about the shuttle but it came on time everyday and picked us up in the afternoons without any hassle much to our relief.  Times  Town to Hotel  9.30  11.30  14.30  16.30  1800    Town to Hotel  10.30  12.30  15.30  17.30  18.30    Visiting the Town Centre  We went to the old town medina.  Personally I think the Medina is overrated. It's dirty and full of shopkeepers battling each other to lure you into their small shops and entice you to buy things.  However you can see Moroccan people in a more natural environment and get souvenirs Aegean oil spices incense etc  You can also be entertained by dancers snake charmers etc at the main Square. If you take pictures you will have to pay them. We went on the hop on hop off bus but didn't think much of it compared with other countries were we have used it. There are two lines one for city and one for outskirts. The tourist bus experience wasn't that exciting and I think the 48hrs ticket is a waste of money. 24 hours ticket is 145 DIR and that's all you need coz tour lasts about an hour without hopping off and the other line that goes to oasis and palamaire lasts 1 hour 10 min. The good thing is the Oasis tourist bus passes by the hotel if you want to get off just ask.    Check Out  On our last day they let us stay in our room until 1pm so we could relax. At check out there was some misunderstanding about taxes they thought we had to pay them but I assured them they were included when we booked our holiday through a third party travel agent. They phoned someone to verify and it turned out I was right and they apologised.  In all we enjoyed our stay at this beautiful resort and if in Marrakkech again we would definitely visit again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: we were surprised by the slow check in and the bad behavior of the lady ( black eyes and hair) in the reception.  she does not know how to talk politely or how to properly treat customers. we were offended by here treatment .  the rooms are very nice and stylish. the hotel is modern and very clean. very great location for golfer.    they definitely need to review the quality of the service and to train their staff. however you feel that there is no manager behind the employees .Not worth 5 stars If you are looking for 5 starts service go to sofitel and do not stay there.    the breakfast is correct  but for a 3 starts hotel.    I do not recommend this hotel at all for people who are used to luxury hotel.

Review_Date: Barry M wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Title: As good as anything I've stayed in before if not better
Review_Text: I've read the last couple of "reviews" on this hotel by others and I cant believe we are talking about the same hotel. I work in the travel industry myself and see lots of hotels when I go away. This one compares with any 5* I've been in. I found the staff to be friendly but due to my lack of French and maybe their lack of English (though the higher up the chain you went the better the spoken English became) we got by - theres not too many ways to order a meal or a beer. The rooms are very comfortable and the hotel is spotless. I agree re the bath tub and the curtainlooks great but a walk in shower would maybe have been better. Apart from that the wi-fi worked perfectlyeven out by the pool. I ate dinner 2 nights during the staythe choice was good and the standard excellentsame for breakfast.The only thing I would change is the choice of TV channels for English speakers - theres only so much CNN news you can watch !! There must have been 15 French channels though maybe balance things out a bit. The hotels bar was very goodthey had nice music playing and a guy called Hamid was very attentive with the service and even had time for a quick chat which is always good. My only 1 gripe was 2 of the nightclubs in the complexMoscova and Narjis - is it really necessary to charge MAD 100 for a bottle of beer which the hotel itself only charges MAD 40 for? Overall a great experience and I would definitely return
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Barely Three stars - but remember this is Morocco
Review_Text: I have been attending a large business meeting at the Hotel this week. In fact we used both the Hotel Du Golf and the adjacent Palmeraie where I have stayed before. This is a very nice complex and has significant potential. Since my last trip in 2011 there has been investments in restaurants bars and other parts of the facilities.    This hotel is OK but certainly not up to European standards. I have been here several days and I see lots of staff trying their best to do a good job but nobody smiles and they have that lost look like the are significantly under paid and overworked. They are very interested in tips and you get that guilty feeling about what you tip when you look into their sad face.    My room was acceptable but nothing more. It has this strange shower set-up with a oval shaped tub and a shower curtain that does not go all the way around the tub. This creates a significant mess and is frankly unworkable. The mirror is off-set from the sink which caused me to cut myself shaving.    Service is OK nothing spectacular and not what you would find in Europe but again this is Morocco and people should not have that expectation at a place like this. In my opinion they have too much staff - people standing around restrooms all night waiting for it to need to be cleaned.    I used the gym which could be a nice place but is not. No paper towels to clean the equipment broken equipment dirty equipment poorly maintained equipment TV system works poorly. No towels to use while working out so the equipment is grimy and unhygienic. The locker room is tight the sauna dirty. And the most difficult issue was lots of locals using the gym and the intimidating manner which they take over the place talk loudly monopolize the equipment and generally make you feel like you should be someplace else.    I thought the food was good. It's not Paris but they did an OK job.    In the end you just have to remember this is Morocco and adjust your expectations.....

Review_Date: Franck F wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: Reception unfriendly and poorly informed about hotel activities.  They gave us a room without heater. WiFi not reaching Inside the room. Room Service too long and very bad quality food. We had to change the room the staff wasn't helpful at all.  Bathroom is a disaster modern style but not practical and broken stuff. No isolation from the room.  Pool is nice but far from hotel in another hotel.  Average quality breakfast and always the same nothing changed.  The New Year Eve diner was very disapointinglong...

Review_Date: Sheri L wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: I really enjoyed the 4 night stay we had at this hotel. The staff was friendly the room was both big and beautiful the bathroom nice. There was a VIP Party which was to take place on our last night in the hotel. Staff informed us upon check in and got us rooms away from the noise. About 20 minutes to the city centre but definitely the moneys worth. I enjoyed my stay here. Since it was December we didnt use the pool but we had a view of the pool area from our room and that as well was lovely. I would stay here again.

Review_Date: Amy S wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Title: Modern, clean and lovely option for Marrakech, though not central
Review_Text: The Hotel du Golf is part of the Palmeraie Golf Resort compound. It is the modern property (versus say the Palmeraie Golf Palace which is in traditional Moroccan style) and is an excellent choice for someone looking to enjoy the modern comforts and amenities. In truth my own style would be more of a riad in the medina (fully traditional) but this is a great choice for either a family holiday with younger children (great for sitting by the gorgeous pool and staying on the compound) or as it was for me a business convention or event. It's a $50 taxi ride into the medina (main square) or the hotel can set you up with a guide and driver. The restaurant is nice but definitely NOT cheap. I disagree with the person who said the service is terrible. I found it to be very good. Look they're not the speediest but they are very kind and nearly everyone in the hotel speaks very good English. I give this a very good. But it's little things like the fact that they NEVER restock the mini bar that keeps this from a higher rating.

Review_Title: Jaw droppingly terrible service, ridiculously expensive, terrible food
Review_Text: I have travelled a lot and stayed everywhere from 5 star hotels to back packer hostels and i have never experienced anything like this place. The staff are the rudest most unhelpful I have ever come across anywhere. Stay in the Medina where there are some lovely inexpensive places.

Having read some of the reviews I can say this is a very good hotel and comfortable rooms. I had a huge room lovely bathroom. The lounge areas were very nice and lovely to sit around in. the pool was great only not heated but it was fine. Plenty of lounges and lots of sitting areas outside in the gardens. Right next to the golf course. The buffet breakfast was adequate and lovely fresh fruits and juices. I would recommend for a few days chill out.

Review_Title: Could be a lovely hotel, but lazy staff, poor service and ant-infested rooms
Review_Text: I stayed in Hotel Du Golf with a group of friends the last weekend of September.    On arrival we were treated with a fresh cold drink and the reception staff were very friendly and welcoming. However this quickly went downhill. When we checked into our room I quickly noticed that it was infested with ants in the bathroom on the floor and most disturbingly in the bed. The sheets too were stained with dark colours. After phoning down to reception they sent up a member of staff with mosquito repellent...clearly ineffective for ants. We then moved to a different room to the other side of the hotel with the most horrendous view of a rubbish dump.    However overlooking this we went down to the pool which was beautiful and relaxing. However this didn't come without problems. Staff were extremely relaxed when it came to processing your orders having to wait up to 20 minutes to receive a bottle of water. Eventually we had to go up to the bar ourselves and stand there until they brought it to us.    Reception staff were less than friendly when we complained about this and saw no issue in ants in our room and rude staff by the pool.    It is a great shame as the hotel itself is lovely with great amenities and close to Marrakech centre but the poor service and unhygienic rooms really put a downer on the long weekend away.

I was a guest at this gorgeous hotel for 10 days. I've stayed at luxury hotels all over the world and I was very impressed with the level of service and professionalism displayed by the hotel staff. I was apart of a very large group and from the moment we arrived we were treated like royalty. Our reception was warm and welcoming from the friendly front desk staff to the refreshing "Moroccan Mojitos." The rooms were spacious luxurious and very clean. The meals were awesome and all of the restaurant staff were professional and friendly. Our meal schedule was very sporadic and Mr. Aziz the Food and Beverage Manager was extremely ameniable. Every time we had a request he bent over backwards to ensure we were satisfied with each and every aspect of our experience. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Marrakech.

Beautiful resort with decent rooms and a great ambiance only to be marred by poor customer service and general staff apathy. This is the first five star hotel we have stayed in where such poor staff attitude has resulted in us never wanting to return to this hotel. The resort has lovely grounds and good activities however getting the attention of reception or anyone to arrange anything is near impossible. A real shame.

Review_Date: Fedoua M wrote a review Sep 2013
Review_Title: Amazing hotel but with little issues
Review_Text: I stayed 4 nights in this beautiful hotel it is located in the palmeraie which is about 10 min drive from the city centre. The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated. The breakfast was first-class with a wide rage of local and international food to choose from.  the letdown of this hotel were: 1- reception staff were not particularily warm or welcoming except the lady Manager who was very professional her name is Nora. 2- the hotel had an issie with sewage smell especially if your room in on the ground level. My booking was for 3 nights originally and when I decided to extend for 1 more night they move me to a room in the ground floor.. it was really bad.

A very nice building with 'nice' staff. Unfortunately the most inept levels of customer service and catering experienced in a declared 5 star hotel - anywhere in the world in recent decades. "Sorry" doesn't cut it when reasonable expectations associated with the advertised product are not met. No travel desk no bespoke excursion products offered. The hotel left a document in my room detailing occupancy levels - pity I didn't have sight of it before booking - clearly other are better informed!. Charges top dollar but deliver at Travel Lodge levels.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: As Hotel du Golf is located in Marrakech palm grove choose one nice and cosy room scattered in its huge park. In your small kasbah you feel like in a douar. Then you need a pleasant walk among palm trees to reach the large swimming pool for extreme sunbathing. For breakfast or lunch try the luxurious buffet in a spacious palace-style room. Warm and professional service except for the slow moving reception. When you are relaxed and need to come back to life have a 15 mn drive and join Marrakech city center.

We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and were really impressed by the great design of the hotel. Unfortunately this is the only positive thing about this hotel. The rooms were lovely but not well maintained. But the worst thing was the service. The reception staff was really not interested and it was hard to get the attention of the bar staff even though it was not busy. We were supposed to stay for a week but checked out earlier and chose a nice riad in the medina. Much more value for money..

I was impressed by the quality of service and reception at entry.    We organized a very big event in Marrakech and was deeply amazed by the way we were treated by the staff of the Golf Hotel: amidst the stress the staff was ready to find immediate solutions to fit the demanding needs of their clients.    Bravo and keep the good work going.    A special thanks go to Safia Ouladsaid and Mouna Ouamalich - my Arabic teachers (tick sweet:-)  Khalid Touil Sarah Babakhyi and last but by no means the least a special thanks to Hassan El Ouarzazi - Front Office Manager for being so proactive in providing solutions to anticipated needs.    How can I forget the whole F&B Team: your were just gr8!    I will always recommend Friends and Clients at all times to your hotel.    See you shortly

Review_Date: maggie amersham wrote a review May 2013
Review_Text: We stayed a couple of weeks ago at this hotel. The hotel is really super very stylish the interior and exterior designs are wonderful. The great thing is that you have the use of all the facilities of this hotel and its sister hotel the Palmeraie Golf so have access to a heated indoor pool and all their other pools as well. Norah who I think is on the Management team deserves a special mention. She was absolutely lovely always checking that we were enjoying ourselves and that we were having a good time. A real credit to the Hotel. The Manager at breakfast was also excellent making sure we had everything we needed.    I would definitely have given the hotel 5 stars but for the poor service around the pool bar where we were just ignored drinks/food ordered didn't turn up etc. We gave up on day 3. However this didn't spoil our time as we went to the sister Hotel Palmerie Golf for pool bar service where we were served immediately and also had lunch at the Italian restaurant and at the golf club which was very pleasant.      The bedrooms were super and we had a really good night's sleep. The shuttle bus was great and the driver really helpful.    All in all we had a wonderful time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Very nice Hotel in an extremely lovely city
Review_Text: It was the first time for me to visit Marrakesh and luckily enough that my accommodation was in Holiday INN Marrakesh as it is located in a lovely resort area with excellent spa  gym & pool facilities.    The room was well equipped and the staff were showing good hospitality.    At the resort area  you can find many international restaurants (but unfortunately none of them offer the local Moroccan cuisine food).    There is a free shuttle bus which you can use to visit Sahat Elfana mosque and King Mohamed V rue.    Overall experience is excellent if you are seeking for a very well established resort and that you can compromise the idea of being near to Marrakesh downtown area.

i would recommend this hotel  beautiful spacious rooms and decor. Excellent breakfast and range of food and options. oh they have free wi-fi as well so was good and the hotel has free shuttle to the city so you save money as well .

Review_Date: Christopher G wrote a review Dec 2012
Review_Text: This is a very nice hotel very well-appointed rooms with all the amenities with styling well beyond normal Holiday Inn standards. Frankly it is more like a Crowne Plaza. My only complaint would be that the door did not block sound from the hallway very well. My room had a nice little balcony big modern bathroom with good lighting which is rare in the EMEA region a tea kettle bathrobes and slippers lots of outlets all the good stuff. The breakfast however was mediocre in selection and quality of food but they did cook eggs to order and make pancakes. It was winter and I was at a conference so I didn't get out much or even see the pool much less use it. In classic American chain style the hotel itself is located well away from the city behind guarded walls well insulated from any danger of actually experiencing the country you are in if you want to avoid it. The golf course is right across the road. So if you want to visit Morocco but feel like you are in a Disneyland version of it this is a good choice. Safe clean comfortable very nice.....American.

Review_Date: Paul J wrote a review Dec 2012
Review_Text: Thats about all the positive side I can say about this resort as its a shambles as far as the management goes. I find it really difficult to find anything positive about this resort and since posting reviews this is the first time I have felt so disgusted at the sheer lack of any service whatsoever.    The check in and onwards was just full of problems throughout but by far the worst was the attitude of most of the staff. Rude and ignorant is the best way I can put it. The barmen were by far a class of their own. It was a privilege to be served by them or at least it felt that way. I asked for a drink and the barman told me they had none. I did think he was joking until he walked off. He spent the rest of the time yawning and leaning on the coffee machine trying to sleep.  The breakfast on the first morning looked like someone had thrown everything across the breakfast room. There was a big corporate party in and as they left the staff simply ignored the mess and left everything where it was. We made up our own table and got our own coffee and tea. The next day there were two managers I think in the room and it was very different. The tables were cleared and places set out.    We went to eat in the resort and went to 5 restaurants and could not get a table despite them being half empty.The receptionist told us in the afternoon there was no need to make a reservation as you can always get a table. We ended up in the bar paying 600mad for very poor quality food.    The courtesy shuttle comes form across the resort and does not even come in sometimes to the holiday inn. The first time we tried the bus pulled in the driver got out began shouting into his mobile then got back in the bus and drove off. We waited till the next one 2 hours later but that didn't even turn up.    Its a long way to the centre and works out expensive every day to go in and out. There is however an abundance of great places to go once there where you will get outstanding service. Kosy Lounge Pepe Nero and Gastro MK. These are the same if not cheaper to eat and by far the best places we found. it will work out cheaper to go there than be spoken to rudely and given at best average food.    if you want to stay at this resort don't expect any service but expect a really good room if you book a suite
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Victoria P wrote a review Nov 2012
Review_Text: Nice hotel. Beautiful spacious rooms and decor. Excellent breakfast and range of food and options.    Wifi FAR too slow and completely unreliable. Service disappointing in the main.    Recommended but not typical Moroccan. Completely modern rooms and nicely styled. Lots of plugs and sockets and amenities in the room. Lovely beds and pillows.    I was with work so didn't explore usage on a personal level.    Big fan of Marrakech. Not a mega fan of this hotel.    I've stayed in many Holiday Inns in the past and definitely the best one.    Think it's their flagship hotel...... ....................

Review_Date: Eddie L wrote a review Nov 2012
Review_Title: Beautiful Hotel, run by Fun & Friendly people
Review_Text: I have stayed in many Holiday Inns across Europe and Asia but this was my first in Africa and what a treat it was! Being a Platinum Holiday Inn Member (Priority Club) I was automatically given a Beautiful and very spacious suite overlooking the golf course and mountains (see Pic Below). The Check in experience was good but not perfect! Saying that the more i got to know the Team the more welcoming and friendly they were this was mainly down to the language barrier their English was about as good as my French!! Although there was a few people that spoke Good English (Mainly Mona Sophia Sara Tariq & Zidane) the 6 people i have mentioned really did go the extra mile and made my stay that little more special (Thank you to you all).  The Food was fantastic and being in the leisure trade all my life i know the difference and the service in general lived up to its 5 star rating. The Rooms/Suites were spotlessly clean and fresh sheets were delivered and made up every day. The beds were far too comfortable which made getting up in the mornings hard work!!!! Seriously though they had either Feather mattress's or a Feather Mattress topper whatever it was i wish i owned one. The only issue i had with the cleaning was there were no wet floor signs and considering the entire hotel flooring is marble it was like a skating rink most mornings.  Overall it was one of the nicest Holiday inns I’ve ever stayed in only super seeded by the Holiday inn Pattaya Thailand.  One thing i didnt realise until my 3rd day was the hotel is part of a complex and short walk to a huge communal Pool restaurants (Japanese Brazilian Moroccan etc) which were all good there’s also clothes and gift shops dotted about. The Hotel is about a 15 minute taxi journey to the albeit wonderful mayhem of the medina and the new town although there is a free courtesy Coach running there and back from the hotel. The Taxi is a fixed rate of 100 Dirham’s (£8.00) each way (excluding tips). One slight fault is the safes in the rooms the strong and sturdy but fixed to the inside of a chest of drawers so you could just pinch the drawer? Not that i was ever concerned about leaving valubles in my room the Hotel was very safe  All in all an awesome Hotel and a fantastic Country....  TIPS:  They don’t speak Arabic nearly all people speak French  They except US Dollars Euros and Sterling as well as their own currency / Dirham’s  Don’t change your money in the UK much better rates in Marrakech (and you are only allowed to take approx £92 /1000 Dirham’s into the country.  Do not take photos of the guards in their ancient and Traditional Uniforms its completely illegal (i found out the hard way!)  Always carry small amounts of currency as tipping is a must and small notes/denominations are hard to come by.  If anyone entertains you (belly dancers snake charmers etc) don’t take a photo of them until you arrange a price first.  If going to the Medina or New Town arrange with the Taxi that drops you off to pick you up at a set time as the competition between Taxi drivers especially outside the Medina is fierce and aggressive to say the least.  Lastly Watch your back/wallet in the Souk Markets!

Review_Title: Excellent hotel, great facilities, lacked atmosphere
Review_Text: Fantastic hotel with excellent clean facilities. The hotel is placed outside of the main centre of Marrakech but provides a free bus for 15 mins in and a cheap taxi ride home again. The pool was gorgeous clean and well kept. The grounds were well manicured and the facilities in the sister hotels on the complex easy to use and hassle free. We ate several times at the various restaurants in the comples nice food but quite pricey. However there is a small shop (out the hotel turn right walk up the road for 10 mins) which sorted us out for drinks and snacks.    The hotel is beatiful and modern immaculate and pristine. The staff were sometimes a little sullen deending on how much you tipped them. The weather (uncontrollable I know) was lovely and the trip was very relaxing. Very very good quality hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Clean and slick but slow service
Review_Text: Nice hotel is about 15 minutes away from downtown. Rooms are clean and pleasant - allow plenty of time if you have any requests for room service etc. Very casual :)    Limited choice of onsite restaurants but the Brazilian bar is the popular choice where entertainment wins over food.

Review_Title: Good hotel but 15 mins by taxi out of town.
Review_Text: We stayed in a suite overlooking the golf course. The room was very well fitted with a great bathroom. Some work had been done at some point on the wall in the bathroom which hadn't been repaired properly a tile was just lying against the wall behind the free standing bath! Other than that (and it really wasn't that noticeable) the room was good. As the weather wasn't great we ate in the hotel a couple of nights. The menu was the same fairly basic lunchtime menu though fine; wasn't very inspiring. Pool and grounds backing onto the golf course were very nice and plenty of sun loungers available. Staff very helpful and friendly and the breakfast buffet was very good. The reasonable prices within the hotel and the close proximity of other restaurants along with everything previously said; made this a very pleasant stay for us and would probably go again.

Review_Date: David P wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Text: We recently returned from a weeks stay at the Holiday Inn Marrakech. Initial impressions were very good we were able to check into our room at 10am we recieved a complimentary upgrade to a suite as we were Platinum Card holder's and the quality and overall appearance of the hotel were of a very high standard and consistent with it's 5 star grading.    However the overall service proposition of the hotel lets it's down very badly. Staff service in the restaurants and bars is virtually non-existant. Its not there wasnt enough staff quite the contrary its just they dont know how to give good service or in some cases any service at all. Merely getting a drink from the bar was a frustrating experience typified by slow service and on many occasions the wrong drink being served.    The main restaurant in the hotel is closed in the evenings and the only option offered is the limited snack bar menu eaten on your laps in the bar. We elected to walk to a neighbouring hotel who shares the site which entailed a 5 minute walk around the back of the hotel via a poorly lit walkway not a very pleasant experience. The site is promoted as having 6 restaurants but when we were there only 2 were open Overall however the quality of the food served was very good especially the Japanese restaurant.    The hotel has 5 star looks but only 2 star service.

Review_Title: Gain a deep peace of mind in a modern design
Review_Text: Superb stay I have enjoyed the design of the room the food the scenery and of course the unique Marrakech weather.  The personnel very smily and helpful.  It is a bit far from the city but that gives just the necessary calm to enjoy the stay and on campus there lot of places to go to a close by night clubs theme restaurants (Moroccan Japanese .......)

Review_Date: Matt F wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Text: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Marrakech for a week in October (In fact Im writing this from our room overlooking the pool!)    This is a fabulous hotel - whilst it carries the Holiday Inn brand so you know it'll be clean when you arrive you'll find that it is actually very unique and different to the stereotypical Holiday Inn. This is a franchise so still quite 'moroccan'.    It looks almost brand new - the rooms are smart and tasteful with enormous super comfy beds and the pool is beautiful and very clean. Staff are great and the Manager is very accommodating with any issues you may have. Not many of the staff speak English but with a few gestures and a bit of explanation you can normally get what you need. Free shuttle to the centre which is great as taxis are about 120 - 150 Dirhams each way. Only reason this is very good and not excellent is because of the food / menu which is really bland and boring. Breakfast is fabulous but they have the same menu for evening meals lunch time at the pool bar and for room service which consists of sandwiches or a choice of 3 pasta dishes. There aren't many other places to eat apart from Leroys so be warned about this. The hotel is aimed at adults and business - don't bring your kids.    We've had a fab time here and would definitely recommend to others but shame about the food.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The staff love to remind you that this is the only 5* Holiday Inn. I would beg to contest the credibility of the 5* rating.    The staff are hit-and-miss. Luckily I speak French and a tiny amount of Arabic so there was no language barrier but you will find that some staff are lovely and others apparently couldn't care less!    Check-in was painfully slow. Initially my reservation could not be found. I had to show a physical copy of my confirmation and then return one hour later. Then there was a copious amount of bureaucratic form-filling to be done; more than other Moroccan hotels that I had stayed in. I was sat down to work through the questionnaire. On completion my room key had still not been issued so there was a further wait.    The pool is very nice; the water had patently been cleaned on our last morning as it was crystal clear. The pool bar is convenient though expensive by local standards.    We lost all the electricity in our room. Despite calling through to reception twice nobody was despatched to assist us and it was only when I went along the corridor and into another room where I found a housekeeper was I able to find assistance.    Next to the hotel is a facility called "Nikki Beach". Here every day incredibly loud music is played from the afternoon into the evening. Unable to rest in the late afternoon I contacted reception to complain about the unreasonable noise and request a room change. I was told "The noise is Nikki Beach which plays music every day". Is that an excuse?! Nobody called me back with notice of a room change even when I called reception thirty minutes later to again request.    A feature that does lend itself to the purported 5* rating is that you are led to your room by a bellhop although I would rather that this were an optional feature as I find it embarrassing when I have just arrived and have not yet procured and local currency that the bellhop is hovering expecting a tip.    At checkout I was issued a bill for the remaining unpaid taxes. I offered my credit card but was told that I could not pay the taxes (MAD equivalent of around GBP 8) because the amount was too little. I asked the hotel to simply charge the card without using my PIN number: apparently not an option. Nor would they waive the charge or allow me to pay it on arrival on my next confirmed stay. Not carrying any cash I had to physically make a trip to a local bank withdraw a note return to the reception and pay the lady!! This delayed my departure by one hour causing me to miss my lunchtime tour bus into the Atlas Mountains which was rescheduled for the next day. At what "upscale/5*" hotel are you ever forced to pay using cash?! I was also overcharged for taxes on a Priority Club Reward Night -- and charged twice for one night.    Finally on my last night I had booked a Terrace Suite but was placed in the lowest-category Standard Room. No partial refund or goodwill gesture was offered.    I have since contacted IHG Guest Relations to try and rectify the billing issue. My query was forwarded to the hotel management and I was promised a response within 48 hours however one month later and alack nothing has been received.    I surmise that the hotel wants as little to do as possible with the IHG/Holiday Inn brands as nobody wears any kind of Holiday Inn uniform or badge there are massive issues with Reward Nights and Priority Club bookings all my bills are printed on "Hotel du Golf" headed paper the majority of the signage regards "Hotel du Golf"; and all their email addresses are hosted on a Moroccan website. Perhaps they are using IHG just for funding or to get a good flow of guests from an international company. Either way It seems that the hotel is complying with the absolute minimum of the terms in its franchise agreement!    It is desperately unfortunate that this is the way things are as this hotel has the potential to be excellent.

stayed here for 8 nights with my partner. what a stunning hotel. loved every minute and cant wait to go back. everytging was perfect from start to finish. although we hired a car as only a 20 minute drive so we did not get chance to use the free shuttle.

Am currently writing this review while sitting at the bar in the Holiday Inn Du Golf before returning home tomorrow. I can honestly say that on arrival we thought oh no what have we done the location and the weather were not good. Now after 7 nights I cannot say enough about the friendliness and kindness of all the staff at the bar and the pool. They are all so kind and friendly and although our conversations have been in broken French and english we got by and they have all been fantastic. Special mention to Toufique aka Manuel Tariq Karim Unes Ismail Nebil Adel and Robert De Niro. The service provided by these guys was second to none and we cannot wait to come back to this oasis in Marrakech to sample the generosity and kindness shown to us both by them all. Our room was absolutely beautiful with fantastic views of the golf course. Some laughs to be had by the so called golfers hitting the flag pole and landing in the bunker. Although this hotel is about 20 minutes from Marrakech it is a relaxing haven from the hustle and bustle of the mad city. Would highly recommend a visit and don't be put off by where it is at the end of the day it is well worth a visit and although quiet it is full of peace and tranquility. One last point Mona on reception was also excellent and sorted out our wifi problem and again was very friendly and helpful. Visit hotel du golf Marrakech you won't be disappointed.

Our room was spectacular with two balconies had been decorated with rose petals and had one of the best bathrooms we had seen. The reception staff were helpful and spoke reasonable English . The only downside was that the bar/restaurant staff spoke little or no English (try ordering beef with chips and veg!).  The pool area was well maintained shame about the rain. The golf course looked very good if only I had my clubs with me.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here during our short break in Marrakech. Upon arrival we were fortunate enough to be upgraded to a suite (Priority Club members) which was very nice. This meant we had a corner balcony with sunbeds. Having read some of the review concerning staff and rudeness we feel they were unjust. The Holiday Inn is what it is. If you're looking for somewhere to use as a base then it's ideal. If however you're looking for something a bit more then maybe this isn't the hotel for you. Clean and tidy helpful staff shuttle bus into the Medina (15 mins away last one 6pm). Can't comment on the food in any great detail as we only had one meal here but what we had was very good. Good breakfast buffet and you're left to relax over breakfast.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I travelled to Marrakech in August knowing that it was Ramadan and that it would be very hot. I had emailed the hotel before booking to ask if there were and restrictions  which would affect tourists. We were advised that there were none.  The hotel building was probably the most luxurious Holiday Inn we had ever visited. We stayed in a King pool suite which was extremely spacious and had a wrap around balcony with 2 sun loungers and a patio set and views over the golf course. The room decor was excellent and seemed quite new. The bathroom had a freestanding tub and a separate spacious shower cubicle. The bed was huge and very comfortable.  The hotel was exceptionally quiet so there was no trouble getting a space by the pool. As with the whole hotel the pool area was clean and generally well looked after.The pool was large with a separate children's area partially in the shade.  On the whole we found the service to be quite friendly but painfully slow especially at lunchtime. Even with only a couple of tables to serve the lunch snacks could take up to an hour to arrive. The food was average and quite expensive as were the drinks - both alcoholic and non alcoholic. The extreme heat meant that it was necessary to take on lots of fluids. A 330ml can of coke cost about £3 from the minibar and about the same from the bar. We found a small shop about a 5-6 minute walk away from the hotel- turn right out of the main entrance. It is open from 10-6 and sells a variety of soft drinks and snacks at a fraction of the cost of the hotel. We stocked up everyday and kept the drinks cold in the minibar.  In the evening there were usually more bar staff than guests but they seemed intent on avoiding eye contact thus making it difficult to get a refill even when sitting at the bar!  The hotel next door has a variety of restaurants most of which were closed probably due to Ramadan but Leroy's Kfe served a variety of International and Morroccan dishes.We ate here several times due to the lack of alternative but the food and Morroccan wine were always very good.  The hotel is a few miles from the centre of Marrakech and there is a hotel shuttle bus to and from several times a day. We used this on one occasion but the city was unbearably hot and dry.  French is the main language and only very basic English is spoken by most of the hotel staff. So brush up on your French before you go!!  For what we wanted - to relax and unwind - we found the hotel more than adequate. The food and service could certainly be improved.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ramesh T wrote a review Aug 2012
Review_Title: Only for business customer not for families....
Review_Text: Hotel Decor is second to none. Cleaning is the only thing we found world class. Rest was absolutily disaster for families staying more than one day at hotel.    No Many staff to serve or if they are there is language problem hard working bar and restuarent staff but there is only training issue and languages barriers.    Rip off prices whithin hotel. once get charged and taxed twice for everything eat drink or use services. Confusing Tax TCS TPT. not once charged twice.    Booking excursion with hotel no no no.    Shuttel service poor if one two people may be ok sometimes if family might aswell pay taxi booked direct with taxi driver haggling with taxi driver is fun.    So many hidden charges when book with hotel. very expensive resort.  Ove all 9 out of 10 for decor and cleaningness  9 out of 10 for comfort  2 out of 10 for facilities within the hotel  2 out of 10 for service  1 out of 10 honesty and fair charges  1 out of 10 understanding families stay within the hotel  5 out of 10 maintenance in room facilities    Will we go back to same hotel ???

In a wonderful location on a resort with good restaurants (the Brazilian is a must) with excellent rooms and decor. The staff are great and the hotel is an excellent oasis after visiting the medina and souks in downtown. The staff are friendly and welcoming and no problems with punctuality on the shuttled to and from the town centre. The gym is great as is the spa and the pool is a must swim. We will return again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Angela R wrote a review Jun 2012
Review_Text: The hotel is very nice and clean. The pool is gorgeous and the rooms big. Unfortunately the staff has been very unfriendly especially the women. We made some very disappointing experiences with the shuttle bus which didn't stop at the hotel to pick us up and it was claimed by the hotel staff that it never stops at the hotel when it's full. This is a 5 * hotel and this is not acceptable! We were left with the impression that tourists are not very welcome there even though they are somewhat dependent on them. All in all the hotel was a bit of a disappointing experience and not worth the price.

Review_Title: Pleasant facility -Unpleasant service and product offering
Review_Text: I would like to note that I was a guest at this facility during a very large Insurance conference that was taking place at the convention center and I know that the hotel and its neighbouiring hotel were both fully booked and probably overloaded with people and requests. Nevertheless this is not a disclaimer for untrained staff and poor product offering.    The rooms were spacious modern and clean. Internet was for free and available at all times. Pool area very relaxing and nice after a long day of work or during the day for lounging around.    Breakfast was not appetizing to the eye nor to the taste buds....    Service providers (waiters head waiters and general staff) need intensive training and education.    A very positive note goes out to the concierge desk who were super pro-active and went the extra mile to help guests with their different requests.    Word of advice: enhance the service and improve the quality of the F&B offering invest in the people...then this place can be the place in town...

Review_Title: Not for families and the staff are dishonest
Review_Text: We spoke to the hotel and the Holiday Inn UK call center and confirmed that the room would be able to cater for a couple and two children ages 10 and 11.    When we got to the hotel the staff said that all the rooms were the same in size and that the website would let you pay extra for 4 in a room but they couldnt fit two extra camp beds in for the children.    We then got a room with 2 full size beds and a camp bed. This was to be cheaper but after 3 requests to speak to a manager about a lower cost we were still charged the higher rate anyway. about US$60 extra.    When we checked out I exchanged US$200 and has given less than the exchange rate quoted on the board and was told when I asked "the exchange rate had changed over night and they hadnt updated the notice board yet". Basically the staff pocketed about US$8 rather and give me the quoted rate.    The La Palmeraie van does not really have a schedule and if full will just skip pick up times as it did during our stay so we ended up taking taxi's to town instead.    This hotel is not for people with a low tolerance for poor service.    On the good side the hotel is quite new the decor very funky and the pool is very nice. Also the food in the hotel was quite good.    However I felt like I was taken for a financial ride and paid U$68 when I shouldn't have.    I tried to complain to Holiday Inn UK operations but they do not have a complaint process online.

Review_Date: jockc d wrote a review May 2012
Review_Text: Very pleasant hotel located at the Palmeraie neighborhood where you can easily find more palm threes than people !    It's the first time ever I try a 5 Stars ( with a reasonable price !) Holiday where colors and decoration took me away from the business and stressful days that I have back in London.    Staff is very welcoming and helpful but needs a little more training in English.    Rooms are clean and smells really good thanks to a young lady from the housekeeping.    The reception was quite busy because they had a business conference at that moment I wish if they can find a way to give priority to individual guests  but to be honest before our turn was up a nice lady from the guest relations helped us with our inquiry it was much appreciated.    The next day we went to get a drink by the pool drink menus are nicely designed and set around the pool we got the whole day to relax and tan.  A young European manager by the pool restaurant served us personally he looked very professional and is even fluent in English.    The hotel offers a shuttle service to the city ( about 18 minutes ) but trust me you would rather sacrifice 200MAD to get a taxi cab to the city instead of waiting for it !    In overall I recommend this hotel if you don't mind to be a little far away from the city. a 3rd restaurant at this location will be fabulous due to the lack of the menu choices for lunch or dinner specially for stays of 3 nights or more.    Will definitely come back    Great hotel great people !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed in a King Terrace suite from the 4-11th April 2012. On first impressions the hotel and staff seemed very good but once you scratched under the surface and it is very disappointing indeed.  The suite itself was very well appointed apart from the fact there was three of us staying in it and it only had one double bed. I had to chase up house keeping and reception three times before an extra bed was supplied. For the whole week we only had enough bathroom linen for two people. Also the electrics in the room were faulty. There were lovely flowers in the room on arrival but they were just left to die over the week.    We found reception staff in general to be very rude. We were told on arrival we were entitled to a free Hammam. That statement was swiftly retracted.  We were told a mini bus service would take us to the city centre. It didn't turn up.  It wasn't until we were being ripped off by the price of our taxi on departure (400mad) that they have a facility to give you cash back on your debit card at reception. We got the feeling the receptionist was related to the taxi driver!    For three days of our stay there was a conference on at the hotel which is really what the hotel is geared up for. In this time we found that the service in the hotel and pool bar were just awful. On one occasion we waited over 30 minutes just for a drink in the pool bar and nearly and hour for our food to be served whilst at the table next to us where there were three Moroccan business people eating they had four members of staff waiting on them. When we had to send the food back because it was stone cold the waitress burst into tears and ran off. The pool bar staff themselves were very friendly they just need some guidance and proper training. There was a European manager hovering around both bars for the week but all he seemed to do was change his suit. We spent most of the week in the hotel next door and had lunch everyday at the golf club. It was cheaper and the service was much better.  The pool itself was clean but found the pool man on one occasion to be asleep when we needed towels and our drinks glasses still by the pool from the previous day.  Would like to think that one day they may be able to provide 5 star service but would have to think very hard before returning.

We stayed in for 2 nights and were pleasantly surprised by the deco of this new hotel. Great hotel if you play golf because the hotel is on the border of a golf course.    The rooms were of good size and pleasant... Bathroom very design but problem with shower curtains that are too small and even if you try avoid you end up having water on your bathroom floor which is less pleasant for afterwards....    Wifi was not working in our room because we were in a bad zone where signal was either weak or not working but friends that were on the other side did not have any problem.    Breakfast could be of better quality so to be up to standards of the design of the hotel. As for the SPA went next door to visit and when we saw the prices decided to avoid it because prices seem to be twice as much than other SPA's in Marrakech (excluding the very top rated ones)    If it wasn't for the WiFi problem I would highly recommend this hotel if you don't mind being far from the center of Marakech.

We were booked into Hotel Du Golf Marrakech - male staff VERY friendly female staff less so and not very helpful sometimes a bit rude! We had no info brochures in our room except a map of the area. I enquired at reception for an adapter but was told to phone maintenance ! No room service was available although there was a menu for same in room. The food was fantastic and they had a wide variety to choose from. A certain Abdullah was extremely helpful in booking us a cab as well as recommend a restaurant where we had a traditional Moroccon experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed in this hotel from 22-28 march. the hotel is very new and looks in the first place very nice however during all my stay for 6 nights the service is not very friendly sometimes even rude and arrogant. please let me tell you our experiences..    1.we ordered an airport pick up at the hotel and it was confirmed to us for 300 mad(28 euro). At arrival we searched for the driver but no one was there. We called the hotel twice they told us to just wait. the tird time we called the hotel they just did not pick up the phone. after 30-40 minutes waiting we were tired and just took a taxi. the ride was only 200 mad so you can imagine how much the hotel earns!    2. The hotel advertises to have a shuttle service to the city.. the next morning we wanted to take the 9.30 shuttle...at 10.10 h still no shuttle!! We complained at reception they told us we had to waite till 10.30 for the next one. they told us that if the shuttle is full it doesnt stop at the holiday innn!! What kind of crap is this?? They dont tell you anything and just leave you waiting in front of thehotel... we were angry and wanted to speak to the manager...the receptionist( guy) told us to sit down and he would call the manager...he/she did not border to come see us. the receptionist arranged a taxi for us to the city. the receptionist was rude and arrogant.    3. We had lunch at the swimming pool bar and ordered simply 2 ceaser salads. 1 with chicken and 1 without. we got 2 salads without and when we told the waiter he looked at the plate without saying sorry went back to the kichen with the plate and came back 5 minutes later. He smashed the plate on the table still not saying a word. we wanted to start eating but the chicked was still comlpletely raw inside! Again we showed the server and again he reacted irritated..no sorry at all. how is it possible an attitude like that?    4. We asked the receptionist how much it would approx. cost uw to take a taxi back from the city to hotel in the evening. he told us 200 mad...after negociating the absolute maximum you should pay is 100 mad even during the evening. i think that the receptionist should protect the hotelguests from being riped and give some more explanation to negociate and tell the guests not to pay more than 100 mad..this is already very high because marrocans pay less with the meter on.    5. The hotel is situated ca. 15 minutes drive from the city. Arond the hotel there are a few restaurants but the prices are sky high. in the hotel and around it there is nothjng really to do so you can get quite bored. although the hotel is furnished very tastfully modern.    6. There is though one lightpoint.. at the poolbar is working one girl. she was the only staff who was very friendly and helpfull.    7. the swimming pool area is nice.    8. We asked the reception if it was possible to get a room with swimming poolview. she said" i will get back to you" she didnt so after 2 days we asked again and again she said " i will get back to you" . Offcourse she never came back to me.. why not just tell me that it was not possible??    Ingeneral the hotel is ok but you can very obvious see that the staff is not trained to give good and friendly service and a genioun smile. I think it is a pitty.

This was an exploring trip and was for 4 nights (5 days) arriving at the hotel by the advanced arranged airport pickup (300MAD) in a Landrover sport. arriving the hotel which was in a very greet and full of palms area and a beautiful Golf course.  The landrover pulled in-front of the HI and you get treated as a 5* property not like the topical Holiday Inn which is more like ongoing family brand. so you get the door men opening the doors for you and getting your luggage staff are multi lingual and speak many languages.  Guest relation in this property is involved more than any other property in any other hotel as the make sure that everything runs into a high level of service quality.    We have been upgraded into the privilege suite which was so beautiful and over looking the gulf course.    First night we have spent at the hotel as we have arrived late and were tired of all the travelling.    We had a greet help through our stay at the hotel from a very beautiful and helpful Guest relation Reem she has recommended the restaurant in the complex called "Dar Khalti" as we wanted to try the Moroccan tagine.  This is an amazing atmosphere and nice live Moroccan music and the food was the best ever we had in Morocco (2 course meal for two with drinks was 1450MAD) It worth every penny great atmosphere and great food.    we have spent the second day in the centre by using the hotel shuttle service to and from the city and they run as  HOTEL ----> CITY  9.30  11.30  14.30  16.30  1800    CITY -------> HOTEL  10.30  12.30  15.30  17.30  18.30    Next day we had breakfast at the hotel restaurant which was a full breakfast and has a Moroccan breakfast section if you want to try it.    you could spend a hall morning walking around the resort.  temperature was a bit cold and needed proper cold clothes from morning till 11 am and from 1800 on-wards in between you would need a good jumper/cardigan.    Reem has recommended jad mahal for dinner and that was the most amazing restaurant I have ever been in my life you would need a reservation definitely or you would be turned back. taxi fare to and from the hotel is around 100-150 MAD always negotiate in advance.    Third day we spent a beautiful time at a day out adventure called ourika we paid 20 Euros including transport to and from the hotel.  Get it for the centre kiosks (Make sure u take a hiking trainers and warm clothes).  in the evening we went to the new Brazilian restaurant opened in the resort and that was a WOW very good fun with live music and carnival dancers on stage. nice Brazilian food and great style atmosphere and music (we spent 1500 MAD for two people).    Tips: don't start splashing ur money in town as everyone will try to beg u harder for money and you would be out of cash at the end of the day if you are a nice person.  Tips: always consult the concierge for all activities and eating.  Tips: don't spend too long in Central Marrakeshis it only need a couple of days to cover it. so try to arrange for excursions and days out to see the real Moroccan.  Tips: Take small taxis they are cheaper.  Tips: use cash machines to withdraw money max is 2000 MAD per day or exchange in town after a good research.    Rgeards
